recipe.name: Spaghetti with Fried Eggs and Pangrattato for One
recipe.description: A simple yet luxurious dish of spaghetti topped with runny fried eggs, garlic, capers, and crunchy pangrattato (breadcrumbs). Perfect for a solo dinner that's both comforting and quick.
steps: Cook spaghetti in a pot of salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving some of the cooking liquid.
In a pan, heat olive oil and butter. Add garlic and fry the eggs, ensuring the whites set while the yolks remain runny.
Toss the cooked pasta with the fried eggs, parsley, capers, and garlic. Add some of the reserved cooking water for a creamier consistency if needed.
Serve the pasta with grated Pecorino Romano and top with crunchy pangrattato.

recipe.name: Chickpea, Pumpkin, and Sage Stew
recipe.description: A hearty and comforting one-dish meal featuring chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and fresh sage. This cozy autumnal stew is easy to prepare with pantry staples and is perfect for chilly evenings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Ditalini, tubetti, or other small pasta like orzo

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped carrot, onion, and sage leaves. Sauté until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and chicken broth. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Add the pasta and cook until tender, about 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

recipe.name: Gochujang-Yogurt Chicken with Garlic Butter Rice
recipe.description: A tangy, spicy chicken dish with creamy garlic butter rice, combining gochujang-marinated chicken with savory garlic rice for a perfect, flavorful meal.
steps: In a bowl, combine the gochujang, yogurt, and 3 cloves of minced garlic. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.

In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the remaining clove of minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in the chicken stock, bring to a simmer, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit, covered, for 10 minutes.

Preheat the broiler and set a rack 6 inches from the heat. Line a baking sheet with foil and set a wire rack on top. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place on the rack. Broil for 5 to 7 minutes per side, until charred and cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise and lemon juice. Thin with a little water, if needed, to reach a drizzly consistency.
To serve, divide the rice among plates. Top with lettuce leaves, cherry tomatoes, and the broiled chicken. Drizzle with the lemon-mayo sauce.

recipe.name: Simple Cheese Soufflé
recipe.description: An easy, light, and flavorful cheese soufflé made with Gruyère, perfect for a mid-week family meal. This unfussy dish is best served with a simple green salad for an elegant yet simple lunch or dinner.
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F. Butter a 7" soufflé dish and coat it with grated Parmesan cheese.
Whip egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks until smooth.
Melt butter over low heat, add flour, and whisk to blend. Add milk and cook, stirring constantly, until thick and smooth.
Remove from heat and stir in the cheese and egg yolks. Fold in the stiff egg whites carefully.
Pour the mixture into the buttered soufflé dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the soufflé is puffed and golden. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Stir-Fried Udon with Bacon, Parmesan & Gochujang
recipe.description: A fusion dish combining elements from Korean, Japanese, and Italian cuisines. This stir-fried udon features thick-cut bacon, gochujang, Parmesan, and egg yolks for a savory, spicy, and creamy pasta experience.
steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the udon.
In a skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat. Add the bacon, scallions, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Saute until the bacon is golden brown.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks, Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Lower the skillet heat, add soy sauce and gochujang, and stir to coat the bacon mixture.
Cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and add the noodles to the skillet. Toss to combine with the bacon and gochujang sauce.
Mix 2-3 tablespoons of the reserved udon water into the egg-cheese mixture to form a sauce. Add the udon and toss to coat.
Season with more salt and pepper if needed, drizzle with sesame oil, and serve garnished with scallions.

recipe.name: Cold Salmon & Potatoes with Dill Yogurt & Paprika Oil
recipe.description: A refreshing, make-ahead dish with tender slow-roasted salmon, boiled yellow potatoes, a bright dill yogurt sauce, and smoky paprika oil for added depth of flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Small yellow potatoes, halved or quartered

steps: Preheat the oven to 275°F. Sprinkle salmon with salt, drizzle olive oil on a baking dish, and roast the salmon for 15 to 25 minutes, flipping halfway, until it reaches 120°F. Let cool to warm, then refrigerate until cold.
Boil salted water and cook the potatoes until tender, 8 to 12 minutes. Drain and let cool.
Heat olive oil in a small pan. Remove from heat and stir in smoked paprika and salt. Set aside.
Blend yogurt with 2/3 cup of dill until smooth and green. Season with salt.
To serve, spread dill yogurt on plates, add flaked salmon and potatoes on top. Drizzle with paprika oil and sprinkle with remaining dill.

recipe.name: Orzo Salad with Green Beans, Tomatoes, Feta & Mint
recipe.description: A bright, Mediterranean-inspired orzo salad with blistered green beans, burst tomatoes, creamy feta, and fresh mint, brought together with a touch of soy sauce for extra umami. Perfect as a side dish or a light meal.
steps: Boil a pot of salted water, add orzo, and cook until al dente, about 8 minutes. Drain and drizzle with olive oil. Set aside.

In a skillet, heat oil over medium-high. Add green beans, season with salt, and let them blister for about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and red pepper flakes, cooking until the tomatoes burst, about 5 more minutes.
Add soy sauce, then stir in the cooked orzo, lemon juice, and half of the feta. Let the feta melt slightly into the orzo.
Take the skillet off the heat, garnish with the remaining feta and fresh mint, and season with black pepper to taste. Serve warm or cold.

recipe.name: White Bean and Kale Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A hearty soup made with white beans, tender kale, and savory sausage, this comforting dish is perfect for cold days. Flavored with rosemary, garlic, and a splash of white wine, it's a nourishing meal that’s easy to make and packed with flavor.
steps: Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the shallots and sauté until almost translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic, carrots, and mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour in the white wine and let it reduce slightly. Add the vegetable stock, beans, and rosemary. Bring to a boil, then add the chopped kale. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
While the soup cooks, brown the sausage in a separate pan. If using crumbled sausage, add it directly to the soup. For linked sausage, slice and stir into the soup.
Taste the soup and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Serve topped with grated Parmesan and crusty bread.

recipe.name: Vegetarian Mushroom Thyme Gravy
recipe.description: A rich and savory vegetarian gravy made with dried mushrooms, fresh thyme, and a touch of sherry. Perfect for topping mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, or even as a sauce for vegetarian mains.
steps: Bring the vegetable stock to a boil and pour it over the dried mushrooms. Let them soak for 20 minutes, then remove the mushrooms and mince or slice them thinly, reserving the stock.
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter and sauté the shallot for about 5 minutes until softened.
Add the flour to the butter and shallots, stirring constantly for 2 minutes to cook the flour.
Gradually stir in 1 1/2 cups of the reserved mushroom stock. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the minced mushrooms, soy sauce, cream, sherry, and thyme. Cook until heated through and thickened to the desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipe.name: Northern Spy's Kale Salad
recipe.description: A hearty kale salad with roasted squash, almonds, aged cheddar, and lemon dressing, this dish brings together bold flavors and textures. Perfect for a fall meal or a refreshing side.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Kale (lacinato or dinosaur), ribs removed and finely sliced

steps: Preheat oven to 425°F. Toss the squash cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast on a baking sheet for about 40 minutes, turning occasionally until tender and caramelized.
In a large bowl, toss the kale with the roasted squash, almonds, and cheddar. Dress with lemon juice and a drizzle of olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Top with shaved pecorino if desired, and serve.

recipe.name: Honey Mustard Chicken
recipe.description: A classic honey-mustard chicken dish that balances sweetness and tang. Perfect for a simple weeknight meal or dressed up for guests. Serve with fresh corn panzanella for a complete meal.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Mix all the marinade ingredients (olive oil to red pepper flakes) in a bowl.
Coat the chicken breast with the marinade, cover, and let rest for 10 minutes or overnight.
Heat oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken for 2-3 minutes on one side, then flip and transfer to the oven.
Bake for 15-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve with fresh corn panzanella for a balanced meal.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Farro with Fennel, Tomatoes & Parmesan
recipe.description: A savory and aromatic dish that combines nutty farro with sweet fennel, cherry tomatoes, and a touch of anchovy. Finished with a bright fennel frond pesto and Parmesan, it’s a simple, flavorful one-pan meal.
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the anchovy and stir until it dissolves into the oil. Add the farro and fry for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.

Add the stock, lemon zest, fennel, garlic, cherry tomatoes, salt, and chile flakes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 25 minutes until the farro is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
While the farro is cooking, make the fennel frond pesto: chop fennel fronds with pine nuts and Parmesan, then mix with olive oil and lemon juice.
Once the farro is done, spoon the fennel frond pesto over the top while still in the skillet. Garnish with more Parmesan and serve warm.

recipe.name: Creamy Tortellini Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A rich and comforting soup with cheese tortellini, Italian sausage, bell pepper, and a creamy tomato broth. Perfect for a cozy meal.
steps: Heat oil and butter in a pot over medium heat. Add bell pepper, sauté for 5 minutes.
Add shallots and garlic, cook for 2 minutes.
Add sausage, oregano, sage, paprika, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Break up the meat and cook until browned, 5 minutes.
Add chicken broth, tomato paste, and puréed tomatoes. Cook for 15 minutes.
Add tortellini, cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cream and Parmesan. Simmer for 1 minute, adjust seasoning, and serve with thyme.

recipe.name: Tahini-Rubbed Chicken With Chickpeas & Dates
recipe.description: An easy one-skillet meal with tahini-rubbed chicken, caramelized dates, chickpeas, and lemon. Perfect for a savory, sticky pan sauce with Middle Eastern flavors.
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Mix tahini, olive oil, honey, cumin, and paprika in a small bowl until smooth.
Rub chicken with tahini mixture, season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix honey and hot water; soak lemon slices.
Layer onion, chickpeas, half the lemon slices, and oil in a skillet; season.
Add chicken, arrange remaining lemon around it. Roast for 20 minutes.
Add dates around chicken, roast another 15-20 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F.
Broil for crisp skin if desired. Stir herbs into chickpeas and onions.
Combine yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, and salt.
Serve chicken and dates with chickpeas, yogurt sauce, and flatbread.

recipe.name: Big Fat Halloumi Salad
recipe.description: A vibrant salad with roasted eggplant, chickpeas, crispy Halloumi, greens, and a tangy honey-sumac dressing. A satisfying Middle Eastern-inspired dish perfect for any meal.
steps: Preheat oven to 450°F and place a sheet pan inside.
Toss eggplant with oil, salt, and sugar. Roast 15 minutes.
Add chickpeas and Halloumi, continue roasting until eggplant is tender and Halloumi is crisp, about 10 minutes.
Whisk dressing ingredients and toss with arugula, radicchio, and parsley.
Top with roasted items, almonds, dates, and tangerine slices. Serve.

recipe.name: Honey-Mustard Chicken with Raw Corn Panzanella
recipe.description: A juicy baked honey-mustard chicken breast served with a fresh corn panzanella salad featuring sourdough, tomatoes, and a tangy dressing.
steps: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, thyme, mustard powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
Place the chicken breast in a shallow dish and pour half of the marinade over it, turning the chicken to coat evenly. Let it marinate for 10-15 minutes.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and sear the marinated chicken breast on each side for about 3 minutes, until golden brown.

Transfer the seared chicken to an oven-safe dish, pour any remaining marinade from the skillet over it, and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F (74°C). Remove from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
While the chicken is baking, prepare the Panzanella. Cut the sourdough bread into cubes, then toast them in a dry skillet over medium heat until they are golden and crisp, about 5 minutes.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the corn kernels, halved grape tomatoes, grated garlic, and toasted sourdough bread cubes.
Pour the remaining half of the marinade over the corn and bread mixture, tossing gently to coat everything evenly.
To serve, place the corn Panzanella on a plate, then slice the chicken and arrange it on top. Drizzle any extra pan juices over the chicken, if desired, and enjoy!

recipe.name: Miso-Ginger Noodles With Tuna & Spicy Sesame Crumbs
recipe.description: Saucy, umami-rich noodles with tender greens, canned tuna, and a topping of spicy sesame crumbs. Quick to make and deeply flavorful.
steps: Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Cook noodles per package instructions; drain.
Prepare the dressing by mixing miso, warm water, ginger, vinegar, oils, and soy sauce in a bowl.
Toss noodles with 3/4 of the dressing, greens, and tuna. Add remaining dressing if desired.
In a skillet, heat oil and toast panko, sesame seeds, and red pepper flakes until golden. Sprinkle with salt.
Serve noodles topped with sesame crumbs.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Vegetable Beef Soup
recipe.description: A comforting Instant Pot soup with ground beef, vegetables, and spices, perfect for cozy weeknights.
steps: In the Instant Pot, turn on the Sauté function, add olive oil, and sauté ground beef until browned. Add onion and garlic, cooking another 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, soy sauce, oregano, celery seed, and bay leaves. Cook briefly until fragrant.
Add carrots, beef stock, and diced tomatoes. Lock the lid and pressure cook on high for 20 minutes.
After cooking, stir in peas and green beans, letting them heat through. Add vinegar, adjust salt and pepper, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe.name: Burnt Broccoli Farro with Smashed Olives
recipe.description: Nutty farro with charred broccoli, smashed olives, feta, and a tahini-lime dressing for a Mediterranean-inspired meal.
steps: Cook farro in salted water until tender; drain.
Pickle red onion in lime juice with salt.
Char broccoli and olives in oil, season with pepper flakes.
Mix lime juice, tahini, and oil for dressing. Toss with farro, broccoli, olives, and feta. Top with pickled onions.

recipe.name: Grilled Ribs With Salt & Pepper
recipe.description: Simple, flavorful grilled ribs seasoned with just salt and pepper for a deliciously charred and juicy finish.
steps: Generously season ribs with salt and pepper.
Preheat grill to high and cook ribs, turning occasionally, until slightly charred and internal temperature reaches 145°F.
Serve hot with rice or a side of choice.

recipe.name: Risotto alla Carbonara
recipe.description: A creamy, indulgent risotto inspired by classic pasta carbonara, featuring guanciale, egg yolk, and Pecorino Romano.
steps: Starting from a cold pan, heat the guanciale in olive oil until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté shallots, then add rice and toast for 1 minute. Add vermouth and reduce completely.
Slowly add hot chicken broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring until absorbed, about 16 minutes. Check if rice is al dente.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg yolk, cream, pepper, and cheese.
Fold the egg mixture into the risotto, mixing until creamy. Top with guanciale, Pecorino shavings, and black pepper.

recipe.name: Jean's Kimchi Fried Rice with Nori
recipe.description: A comforting kimchi fried rice made with crispy Spam, ripe kimchi, and a topping of crushed nori. Served with a runny fried egg for the ultimate savory meal.
steps: Heat sesame oil in a large nonstick pan or wok over medium heat.
Add diced Spam and cook until crispy, then add kimchi (reserve juice) and sauté until fragrant and darker in color.
Add rice, breaking it up with a spoon, and pour in kimchi juice, soy sauce, and additional oil if needed. Stir continuously for 5-10 minutes until well-combined and slightly toasted.
Mix in crushed seaweed, then serve each portion with a fried egg on top.

recipe.name: Slow Cooker Pasta e Fagioli
recipe.description: A comforting Italian-style soup with beans, pasta, and tomatoes, simmered in a slow cooker for a rich, savory flavor.
steps: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil and sauté onion, carrot, and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add thyme, rosemary, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper, and cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a slow cooker. Add tomatoes (broken into pieces), beans, stock, bay leaf, and Parmesan rind. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours or on low for 5 hours.

If serving immediately, add pasta directly to the slow cooker and cook for 15 minutes. Alternatively, cook pasta separately and add to each bowl before serving to prevent it from absorbing too much broth.
Serve with chopped parsley and grated Parmesan, with crusty bread on the side if desired.

recipe.name: Giambotta (Italian Summer Vegetable Stew)
recipe.description: A traditional Italian vegetable stew made with summer produce like potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes. Perfect for using up fresh garden vegetables.

ingredients.ingredient_name: white or yellow onion, finely chopped

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, and cook until browned.
Add potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, green beans, and bell pepper. Stir to coat with oil.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and broth, stir, and cover. Simmer for about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.
Add cherry tomatoes and basil. Stir and cook uncovered for 2-3 minutes to let the tomatoes soften.
Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve hot or cold with grated cheese and day-old bread, if desired.

recipe.name: Weeknight Cassoulet
recipe.description: A simplified, quick take on traditional cassoulet, featuring Italian sausages, canned beans, and a crispy breadcrumb topping. Perfect for a cozy weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cans of cannellini or white northern beans (undrained)

steps: Heat 2 tbsp of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Prick sausages with a knife and cook, turning occasionally, until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board.
Add onion, celery, and garlic to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper, cooking until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add beans with their liquid, water, and additional salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer. Slice sausages and return to the skillet, then stir in vinegar and remove from heat.
Preheat the broiler with the rack in the top position. In a small bowl, mix panko, parsley, remaining 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Scatter over beans and sausage.
Broil until the top is golden brown, 1-2 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Cajun Chicken & Rice
recipe.description: A flavorful one-pot Cajun chicken and rice dish featuring a homemade spice blend, cooked with chicken thighs, bell peppers, onions, and celery for a satisfying meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small green bell pepper, seeded and chopped

steps: In a small bowl, mix paprika, salt, oregano, thyme, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, and red pepper flakes to make the Cajun seasoning.
In another bowl, combine 1 tbsp of Cajun seasoning with 1 tsp olive oil to make a paste. Rub the paste onto the chicken thighs.
In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the remaining oil. Sear chicken, skin-side down, until golden, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté onion, bell pepper, and celery with butter, seasoning with salt and pepper. Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Stir in 1 tbsp Cajun seasoning, then add broth and rice. Bring to a simmer, place chicken on top, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes until rice is tender.
Fluff rice with a fork, garnish with parsley and scallions, and serve.

recipe.name: Shrimp Tacos with Charred Corn & Peach Salsa
recipe.description: Grilled shrimp tacos topped with a fresh, summery salsa of charred corn, peach, avocado, and a tangy lime crema. Perfect for a light and flavorful meal.
steps: Char the corn over a medium flame until evenly charred, about 4-5 minutes. Remove kernels and place in a bowl.
Combine corn with peach, onion, cucumber, jalapeño, avocado, cilantro, lime juice, and olive oil. Season with salt.
In another bowl, marinate shrimp with lime zest, juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper for 10 minutes.
Char tortillas over an open flame or on a grill, about 30 seconds per side. Wrap to keep warm.
Heat a grill pan and cook shrimp until charred and cooked through, about 1 minute per side.
Mix sour cream with lime juice, salt, and pepper. Thin with water if needed for drizzling consistency.
Assemble tacos with shrimp, corn-peach salsa, and lime crema, serving with extra lime wedges.

recipe.name: Autumn Salad with Horseradish Vinaigrette
recipe.description: A warm autumn salad with roasted Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, butternut squash, white beans, and pomegranate seeds, tossed in a tangy horseradish vinaigrette.
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F. Place Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, and butternut squash on a baking tray. Drizzle with olive oil, balsamic, salt, pepper, nutmeg, and cayenne. Toss to coat.
Roast in the upper third of the oven for 35 minutes, until edges are browned.
For the vinaigrette, blend horseradish, garlic, shallot, honey, white wine vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper until smooth. Adjust seasoning to taste.
When the roasted vegetables are done, add the white beans to the hot tray and toss together. Let cool to room temperature.
Add pomegranate seeds, arugula, and a generous drizzle of vinaigrette. Toss to coat and serve.

recipe.name: Pasta with Creamy Cherry Tomato Sauce
recipe.description: A simple, creamy pasta dish featuring charred cherry tomatoes, garlic, and anchovies, finished with fresh herbs. Perfect for a summery weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: short-shaped pasta (such as penne, fusilli, or cavatappi)

steps: Set a large pot of water to boil. Season with salt when it starts to simmer.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add tomatoes, season with salt, and cook for about 5 minutes until tomatoes char and release juices.
Add anchovies, garlic, and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Stir and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in the half-and-half, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Cook pasta until al dente. Drain and add pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat. Adjust salt and red pepper if needed.
Serve hot, topped with fresh herbs.

recipe.name: Spicy Watermelon with Tomatoes, Prosciutto & Salted-Lime Yogurt
recipe.description: A refreshing summer salad with watermelon, tomatoes, prosciutto, and salted-lime yogurt, topped with spicy chile crisp for a burst of flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: chile crisp or favorite chile sauce

steps: Combine watermelon, tomatoes, and cucumber in a bowl with sea salt, 2 tsp olive oil, and 2 tsp lime juice. Toss gently and set aside.
In a small bowl, make salted-lime yogurt by mixing yogurt with 1 tbsp lime juice, 1 tsp olive oil, and flaky salt.
In another small bowl, mix chile crisp with remaining lime juice.
On a large platter, spread a layer of yogurt, then top with watermelon mixture. Arrange prosciutto, basil or mint, and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Drizzle chile crisp over and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Turkey & Mushroom Burgers
recipe.description: A healthier twist on classic burgers with ground turkey, caramelized mushrooms, and onions for added flavor. Great with Swiss cheese and a pretzel bun.
steps: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms, stir, and continue to sauté for about 20 minutes until softened. Cool completely.
In a bowl, mix the mushroom-onion mixture, ground turkey, egg, and salt. Form into four patties.
Heat a large cast-iron skillet over high heat, add canola oil, and sear patties for 3 minutes per side, until browned. Top with cheese, if desired.
Serve on a bun with your favorite toppings.

recipe.name: Crunchy-Shell Cauliflower Tacos
recipe.description: Inspired by classic ground-beef tacos, these vegetarian tacos feature roasted cauliflower in crispy shells, with toppings like shredded lettuce and pepper jack cheese.
steps: Preheat the oven to 450°F and line two sheet pans with silicone mats or parchment paper.
Remove the bottom of the cauliflower stem and leaves, then roughly chop. Process in two batches until almost riced, with a few chunks remaining.
Spread cauliflower evenly on both sheet pans. Toss with olive oil, chili powder, and salt, then spread out for even roasting.
Roast for about 20 minutes, rotating pans halfway through for even browning.
While the cauliflower roasts, warm the taco shells in the oven until crisp, about 2 minutes.
Assemble tacos by layering cauliflower, lettuce, and cheese in each shell.

recipe.name: Brown Butter Couscous With Spring Vegetables
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful couscous dish with nutty brown butter, sumac, and vibrant spring vegetables. Perfect as a side or light main.
steps: To make brown-butter couscous: In a saucepan, melt 3 tbsp butter over medium heat until browned and nutty. Add couscous, 1 tsp sumac, and salt. Stir, then add 1 1/4 cups water, bring to a boil, add peas, cover, and let stand for 5 minutes.
For pearl couscous: Brown butter as above, then toast couscous in the butter for 3 minutes. Add water per package instructions, sumac, and salt. Add peas in the last 5 minutes. Fluff when done.

For vegetables: Slice two radishes thinly for garnish. Quarter remaining radishes and sauté in butter with sumac, salt, and pepper until caramelized. Add almonds and currants to the pan, toast, then wilt in spinach or arugula.
Combine couscous with vegetables, season with lemon juice, and top with feta and reserved radish slices.

recipe.name: Cold Soba With Perilla Oil Dressing
recipe.description: A quick, refreshing Korean-inspired soba noodle dish with a nutty perilla oil dressing, topped with sesame seeds and seaweed. Perfect for hot days or as a light meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: roasted dried seaweed (Korean gim or Japanese nori)

steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the soba noodles.
In a large bowl, mix perilla oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Set aside.
In a mortar and pestle, coarsely grind the sesame seeds. Crush the seaweed sheet by hand or with a plastic bag and set aside.
Cook soba noodles for exactly 4 minutes. Rinse in cold water several times to remove starch, then drain well.
Add the noodles to the bowl with the dressing and toss to coat.
Plate the noodles, topping with crushed sesame seeds and seaweed. Garnish with cucumber and shredded chicken, if using. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Vegan Pasta al Limone(ish)
recipe.description: A creamy, tangy pasta made with a cashew-based sauce, lemon juice, and nutritional yeast, perfect for a light and flavorful vegan meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: raw cashews, soaked in hot water
flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest

steps: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain.

In a blender, combine soaked cashews, lemon peel and juice, olive oil, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup of reserved pasta water. Blend until smooth, adding more water to achieve desired consistency.
Return pasta to pot, add sauce, and toss to coat. Thin with additional pasta water if needed. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve with flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest on top.

recipe.name: BLT Salad
recipe.description: A fresh twist on the classic BLT sandwich, featuring crispy bacon, toasted sourdough croutons, butterhead lettuce, and a tangy tomato-mayo dressing.
steps: Cut crusts off bread and tear into pieces. Add bacon to a skillet over medium heat, cook until crispy, and transfer to a plate, reserving the fat.
In the same skillet, add bread pieces to bacon fat, season with salt and pepper, and cook until golden and crispy. Let cool.
Tear lettuce leaves into bite-sized pieces, wash, and dry well.
Blend half the tomatoes with mayonnaise, salt, and pepper until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings.
Cut remaining tomatoes in half, and break up bacon into pieces.
In a large bowl, toss lettuce, croutons, bacon, and dressing. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Baked Salmon With Brown-Buttered Tomatoes & Basil
recipe.description: A delicious, simple baked salmon with brown butter, fragrant mustard seeds, and roasted cherry tomatoes, finished with fresh basil.

ingredients.ingredient_name: salmon fillet, skin on or off

steps: Preheat oven to 325°F. Place salmon skin-side down on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.

In a medium saucepan, melt butter with mustard seeds over medium heat, swirling until butter is browned and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes. Add vinegar, red pepper flakes, and cherry tomatoes, and cook for 2-3 minutes until tomatoes start to burst.
Pour the tomato mixture over the salmon, spreading butter and seeds evenly. Bake for 15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily.
Let the salmon rest briefly, top with fresh basil, and season with flaky salt. Serve with crusty bread, pasta, or rice.

recipe.name: Tacos Gobernador
recipe.description: A delicious shrimp taco recipe from Sinaloa, featuring buttery shrimp, melted cheese, and a mix of sautéed vegetables in a toasted flour tortilla.

ingredients.ingredient_name: queso asadero or Monterey Jack cheese, grated

steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Cook shrimp in an even layer until just starting to brown, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to a bowl.
Reduce heat to medium, add butter, and sauté onion, poblano, celery, serrano, garlic, oregano, salt, and coriander until softened, about 6-8 minutes.
Add tomato and cook until it begins to break down, about 5 minutes. Transfer to the bowl with shrimp and toss to combine.
Wipe skillet and heat tortillas until lightly toasted on one side. Flip, add cheese, shrimp filling, and fold.
Cook until cheese melts, then serve with lime wedges and salsa.

recipe.name: Stovetop Mac & Cheese With Garlic Powder & White Pepper
recipe.description: A quick and creamy stovetop mac and cheese inspired by classic flavors, featuring garlic powder and white pepper for extra depth.

ingredients.ingredient_unit: for pasta water and to taste

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente, checking after 4 minutes. Drain.
Return pot to medium heat, add cream, and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.
Reduce heat to low, add cheese, garlic powder, and white pepper. Whisk until smooth.
Stir pasta into sauce, adjusting seasoning as needed. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Peach & Tomato Salad With Fish Sauce Vinaigrette
recipe.description: A vibrant summer salad featuring juicy peaches, tomatoes, and corn, all tossed in a savory, tangy fish sauce vinaigrette.

ingredients.ingredient_name: greenhouse tomatoes or heirlooms, cut into ½-inch wedges
large heirloom tomato, cut into chunks
sweet corn, kernels cut from the cob

steps: In a jar or small bowl, combine all vinaigrette ingredients and shake or whisk until emulsified. Adjust seasoning as desired.
Arrange the peaches, tomatoes, and corn on a serving plate. Pour vinaigrette over the salad, then season with black pepper and flaky salt to taste.

recipe.name: Eduardo de San Angel’s Cilantro Soup
recipe.description: A vibrant, creamy cilantro soup inspired by a beloved Mexican restaurant dish, featuring zucchini and spinach for added depth and topped with queso fresco and crema.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small jalapeño pepper, seeded and chopped
cilantro, stems intact, plus more for garnish

steps: In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and onion, cooking until the onion is translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add zucchini, yellow squash, and jalapeño; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add spinach and cilantro, reserving a few sprigs for garnish, and cook until greens have wilted, about 3 minutes.
Pour in broth, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cumin, salt, and pepper, and cook for another 5 minutes. Let soup cool slightly.
In batches, puree the soup in a blender. Strain to remove solids, then rewarm before serving.
Garnish with cilantro sprigs, queso fresco, and crema if desired.

recipe.name: Gochujang Baby Back Ribs
recipe.description: Tender and flavorful baby back ribs with a Korean-inspired gochujang BBQ sauce, combining traditional Korean ingredients with American BBQ style.
steps: Preheat oven to 250°F. Combine gochugaru, ground ginger, and garlic powder in a small bowl.
Remove membrane from the underside of the ribs. Season ribs with salt and pepper, then rub with the spice mixture.
Wrap ribs tightly in foil with the seam on top. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 1.5 hours.
Mix gochujang, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, sugar, minced garlic, and minced ginger in a bowl to make the sauce.
Remove ribs from the oven, open foil, and spread sauce over the ribs. Rewrap and bake for another 30 minutes.
Preheat broiler. Open foil, baste ribs with residual sauce, and broil for 5-10 minutes until charred.
Cut ribs into individual pieces and serve.

recipe.name: Speedy Chicken Potato Curry
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful chicken curry with potatoes, cooked in a fragrant spice-infused sauce of tomatoes and cream, perfect for weeknight dinners.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
russet potato, skin-on and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

steps: Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cardamom, cinnamon, and bay leaf, letting them sizzle for a few seconds. Add cumin seeds and cook until fragrant.
Add the chopped onion and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deep golden brown. Stir in the garlic and cook for another minute.
Add the canned tomatoes, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes, allowing the tomatoes to soften. Stir in the salt, chile powder, turmeric, garam masala, and sugar.
Add the potato and chicken pieces to the pan along with water. Stir, cover, and cook on medium heat for 10 minutes, until the chicken and potatoes are tender.
Stir in the cream and chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

recipe.name: Pisto Manchego With Eggs
recipe.description: A Spanish vegetable stew similar to ratatouille, made with tomatoes, peppers, onions, and zucchini, topped with fried eggs for a hearty meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: zucchini or yellow squash, peeled and chopped
Italian peppers or bell peppers, cored and chopped

steps: In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add olive oil. Once hot, add onions and a pinch of salt, stirring continuously until golden.
Add zucchini and a splash more olive oil. Sprinkle with a pinch of salt and cook until softened.
Stir in peppers and more olive oil if needed. Cook for a few minutes, then add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, stirring to release their moisture. Cook until tomatoes break down. Add sherry vinegar (if using), water, and let simmer for at least 10 minutes.
In a separate pan, heat olive oil and fry eggs to your preferred doneness.
Serve the pisto warm, topped with a fried egg for each portion. Pair with crusty bread or baguette.

recipe.name: Corn, Shrimp & Avocado Salad With Chipotle-Pepita Dressing
recipe.description: A no-cook, Tex-Mex inspired salad with fresh romaine, corn, creamy avocado, and shrimp, topped with cotija cheese and a smoky chipotle-pepita dressing.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large head romaine (or 2 romaine hearts), trimmed
cotija, queso fresco, or feta, crumbled
extra-virgin olive oil or sunflower oil
full-fat sour cream or Greek yogurt

steps: Combine all dressing ingredients in a mini food processor or blender. Process until smooth. Taste and adjust salt, acidity, and spice as needed.
Toss shrimp in 2 tablespoons of the dressing. Season with a pinch of salt.
Arrange half the romaine on a serving platter. Drizzle some dressing over the leaves and scatter corn, avocado, cotija, and shrimp on top. Season lightly with salt.
Repeat with the remaining romaine, dressing, and toppings. Sprinkle pepitas over the salad.
Serve extra dressing on the side for individual preferences.

recipe.name: Grilled Shrimp With Romesco Sauce
recipe.description: A simple and flavor-packed dinner featuring smoky, tender grilled shrimp coated in a tangy, nutty romesco sauce made from pantry ingredients. Perfect with bread, rice, or vegetables.

ingredients.ingredient_name: roasted piquillo or red bell peppers
sun-dried tomatoes packed in olive oil
olive oil from the jar of sun-dried tomatoes
large or jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails on
olive or neutral oil for grilling

steps: In a food processor, pulse almonds until finely ground. Add roasted peppers, olive oil, sun-dried tomatoes, reserved oil, water, sherry vinegar, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes. Blend until smooth. Adjust salt, pepper, and vinegar to taste. Reserve 2/3 cup for shrimp marinade.
Pat shrimp dry and toss in a bowl with 2/3 cup romesco sauce and kosher salt. Let marinate for up to 12 hours or grill immediately.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Clean and oil the grates.
Grill shrimp for 2–3 minutes on the first side until slightly charred. Flip and grill another 1–2 minutes until opaque and cooked through. Remove from grill.
Squeeze lemon juice over the shrimp and serve with remaining romesco sauce.

recipe.name: Broccoli, White Bean & Cheddar Bake
recipe.description: A comforting one-skillet dinner combining caramelized tomato paste, broccoli, white beans, and melty cheddar cheese. Perfect with crusty bread for sopping up the delicious sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: anchovies, minced and smashed into a paste

steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
In a 12-inch ovenproof skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Sauté for 6–8 minutes until golden.
Stir in anchovies and garlic, cooking for 1 minute. Add tomato paste and stir for 30 seconds, lowering the heat to avoid burning.
Add broccoli and stir to coat in tomato paste. Cook for 3 minutes until broccoli softens slightly. Add stock, white beans, lemon zest, and red wine vinegar. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar over the mixture and transfer the skillet to the oven. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes until cheese is browned and bubbly. Serve warm with crusty bread.

recipe.name: Heirloom Tomato Salad With Curry Lime Yogurt Dressing & Pickled Onions
recipe.description: A vibrant salad featuring heirloom tomatoes, Thai basil, a tangy curry lime yogurt dressing, and quick-pickled red onions, perfect for summer gatherings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: colorful heirloom tomatoes, halved or quartered if large
fresh Thai basil, torn, plus small leaves for garnish
red onion, thinly sliced into half-moons

steps: In a medium bowl, gently toss tomatoes and torn basil with smoked sea salt and black pepper. Let stand for 10 minutes.
To prepare the dressing: Whisk yogurt, olive oil, curry powder, and lime juice until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste, then chill until ready to use.

For the pickled onions: Combine vinegar, sugar, coriander seeds, 1 cup water, and kosher salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 5–8 minutes. Pour over onions in a heatproof container and let cool to room temperature.
To assemble: Spread curry lime yogurt dressing on a serving platter. Top with tomato mixture. Garnish with pickled onions and basil leaves. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Spice Merchant Cauliflower Couscous
recipe.description: A deeply spiced cauliflower dish masquerading as couscous, blended with a mix of spices, citrus, nuts, and raisins.
steps: Place the sultanas in a bowl and pour warm water over them. Leave the sultanas for about 15 minutes, until plump. Drain and discard the water.

Heat a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Reduce the heat to medium low, add the cashew nuts and toast them for about 8 minutes, until lightly golden and gently charred. Stir frequently to make sure that cashew nuts do not burn. Let the cashew nuts cool. Cut half of the cashew nuts into smaller pieces (or simply crush them with your hands).

Break the cauliflower into florets, making sure to leave behind as much of the stem as possible. Chop the florets into smaller pieces. Transfer the cauliflower into a food processor in batches, and pulse until the pieces are finely chopped and resemble couscous. Be careful not to over-process.
In a large sauté pan, heat three tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the cauliflower couscous to the pan and cook for about 7 minutes, stirring frequently.

Remove the couscous from the heat and let it cool. Add the sultanas, cashew nuts, za’atar, cumin, parsley, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, and the remaining two tablespoons of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Leave the couscous for about 15 minutes for the flavors to combine. Serve at room temperature.

recipe.name: Tomato-y, Yogurt-y Shakshuka
recipe.description: A flavorful North African dish featuring eggs poached in a spicy tomato and red pepper sauce, enhanced with dollops of yogurt for added tanginess.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Canned diced or crushed tomatoes (28-ounce can)

steps: In a large saucepan over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the harissa, tomato paste, red peppers, garlic, cumin, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Sauté for about 10 minutes, until the peppers soften.
Add the canned tomatoes, bring to a gentle simmer, and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Make six little dips in the sauce. Gently break the eggs and carefully pour each into its own dip. Simmer gently for 8 to 10 minutes, until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Remove from heat, let it settle for a couple of minutes, then spoon into individual plates. Serve with dollops of labneh or Greek yogurt.

recipe.name: Oven-Roasted Egyptian Mesaka’a
recipe.description: A simplified and flavorful Egyptian eggplant casserole with roasted eggplant, cinnamon-spiced tomato sauce, and optional ground beef, served with rice or pita bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
green or red bell peppers, seeded and roughly chopped
beef or chicken stock (or water for vegetarian)
cooked white rice or pita bread

steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Slice the eggplants crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick disks and arrange on a sheet pan. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil and season with salt. Roast for 30–35 minutes until caramelized.
While eggplant roasts, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté onion and bell peppers until browned and softened.
Add tomato paste, cinnamon, paprika, cumin, and chili powder (if using). Cook for 2 minutes until the tomato paste darkens slightly.
Add garlic and ground beef (if using). Cook for 1–2 minutes until the beef begins to brown.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and stock (or water). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper.
Layer half the roasted eggplant in a 3-quart baking dish. Top with half the sauce, then sprinkle with almonds (if using). Repeat with remaining eggplant and sauce.
Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10 more minutes. Serve hot with rice or pita bread.

recipe.name: Mee Goreng Mamak (Mamak-Style Stir-Fried Noodles)
recipe.description: A flavorful and nostalgic Malaysian noodle dish combining fresh yellow noodles with a savory-sweet sauce, potatoes, tofu, and choy sum, perfect for a quick dinner.
steps: Wash and boil the potato until fork-tender, about 30 minutes. Peel and cut into cubes.
Mix all sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside.
Rinse fresh yellow noodles in cold water to loosen and remove excess oil, or blanch briefly in hot water.
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a wok. Sauté garlic until aromatic. Add choy sum and noodles, tossing to combine.
Push ingredients to the side, add more oil if needed, and pour in the plant-based 'egg'. Let it set before mixing with the noodles.
Add cooked potato cubes, tofu slices, and the prepared sauce. Toss gently to combine, taking care not to break the noodles.
Fold in mung bean sprouts and cook for another minute. Adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve topped with shredded green lettuce, chili slices, fried shallots, and lime wedges.

recipe.name: Epic Cobb Salad for One
recipe.description: A decadent Cobb salad perfect for one, featuring crispy bacon, juicy chicken thigh, creamy avocado, blue cheese, tomatoes, and a perfectly boiled egg, arranged on a bed of radicchio.

ingredients.ingredient_name: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
large organic egg, boiled and quartered

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a cold, oven-safe pan over medium heat, cook bacon for 8–10 minutes until crispy on both sides. Remove and set aside.

Season chicken thigh with salt and pepper. Sear skin-side down in the bacon fat for 2–3 minutes. Turn over and roast in the oven for 15 minutes, or until cooked through. Let cool slightly, then carve into bite-size pieces.
Arrange radicchio on a large plate. Drizzle with malt vinegar, olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Assemble the salad: Arrange bacon, chicken, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado, and egg in sections over the radicchio. Season tomatoes, avocado, and egg with salt and pepper. Garnish with chives.

recipe.name: Summer Vegetable and Glass Noodle Salad
recipe.description: A refreshing noodle salad inspired by Vietnamese flavors, featuring vermicelli noodles, shredded chicken, fresh summer vegetables, herbs, and a tangy lime-fish sauce dressing.

ingredients.ingredient_name: light brown sugar or agave nectar

steps: In a large bowl, whisk together lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, garlic, and chile. Add 3 tablespoons of water to thin the dressing.
Add the cooked vermicelli noodles, chicken, cucumber, carrot, beets, herbs, and peanuts to the bowl. Toss everything together to coat evenly in the dressing.
Serve immediately, chilled, or at room temperature.

recipe.name: Vicky Bennison's 'Cupboard Is Bare' Pasta & Chickpeas
recipe.description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish made with pantry staples like canned chickpeas, garlic, and rosemary, finished with Parmigiano for a quick and delicious meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: good-quality pasta (e.g., fusilli lungi, penne, or orecchiette)

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, heat a generous drizzle of olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook gently until softened but not browned.
Add the drained chickpeas to the pan and stir well. Use the back of a spoon to crush about half of the chickpeas for a creamier texture.
Stir in the minced rosemary and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Add a ladleful of the starchy pasta cooking water and let it simmer for about a minute.
Drain the pasta and toss it in the pan with the chickpea mixture. Mix well to coat the pasta.
Serve immediately, topped with grated Parmigiano.

recipe.name: Pork Piccata
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful twist on classic piccata, featuring thinly pounded pork loin slices sautéed to perfection, topped with a tangy lemon-caper sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Smithfield Roasted Garlic and Herb Marinated Fresh Pork Loin Filet

steps: Slice the pork loin into 1/4-inch slices and lightly pound them until thin. Season both sides with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour, shaking off excess.
Heat 4 tablespoons of butter and the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium-high heat. Sauté pork slices for 3 minutes per side until nicely browned.
Remove pork from the pan. Deglaze the pan with lemon juice, chicken stock, and capers, scraping the bottom with a wooden spoon. Cook until the liquid reduces by about 1/3.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper, then stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to slightly thicken.
Plate the pork and spoon the lemon-caper sauce over it. Garnish with parsley and serve.

recipe.name: Walnut-Lentil Lettuce Wraps
recipe.description: A simple, pantry-driven recipe featuring hearty lentils, toasted walnuts, and tangy pickled vegetables, served in lettuce leaves for a refreshing and light meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: finely chopped pickled or fermented vegetables

steps: In a saucepan, combine lentils with 2 cups of water. Bring to a confident simmer, then reduce to a soft simmer for 20–30 minutes until tender. Drain and drizzle with pickle brine to taste while still warm.
Combine 2 tablespoons of canola oil and 2 tablespoons of pickle brine in a small bowl. Shake or whisk until emulsified. Taste and season with salt as needed.

Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add 2 teaspoons of canola oil. Toast the walnuts, stirring frequently, until golden and fragrant, about 2–3 minutes. Add the remaining teaspoon of oil and the cooked lentils.
Using a fork or potato masher, lightly smash the lentil-walnut mixture to break it down while keeping it chunky. Season with salt to taste.
To serve, arrange lettuce leaves on a plate. Fill each with the lentil-walnut mixture and drizzle with the pickle brine dressing. Top with additional pickled vegetables if desired.

recipe.name: Chorizo & Potato Tacos
recipe.description: A savory, satisfying taco recipe featuring crispy potatoes and flavorful fresh chorizo, served in warm corn tortillas and topped with fresh cilantro.

ingredients.ingredient_name: baking potatoes, scrubbed and cubed (½-inch pieces)

steps: Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water by 1 inch. Add 1 tablespoon of salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to medium and simmer for 8 minutes until just tender. Drain and shake the colander to dry the potatoes.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Crumble chorizo into the pan and cook for 8 minutes until browned and the liquid has evaporated.
Add the onion and drained potatoes to the skillet. Cook for about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are crisp. Add more oil if needed and season with salt to taste.
Divide the potato mixture among the warm tortillas and sprinkle with chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Asparagus With Fried Eggs & Sizzled Paprika Croutons
recipe.description: A simple yet satisfying dish highlighting crisp-tender asparagus, smoky paprika croutons, and perfectly fried eggs with runny yolks, perfect for any spring meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large slices crusty bread, torn into bite-sized pieces
asparagus, tough ends trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: In a skillet, heat 1 ½ tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon butter, and garlic over medium heat. Add smoked paprika and bread pieces. Sauté until croutons are lightly toasted and crisp, about 3 minutes. Move croutons to the edges of the skillet.
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and asparagus to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Sauté for about 4 minutes until the asparagus is crisp-tender and croutons are crispy.

In a separate skillet (or the same skillet with asparagus removed), heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter over medium-high heat. Crack eggs into the skillet and season with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika. Fry until whites are crispy and yolks are runny, about 2–3 minutes.
Serve the asparagus and croutons topped with fried eggs. Enjoy warm.

recipe.name: Boosted Jook
recipe.description: A comforting Chinese rice soup, also known as congee, simmered with fresh ginger and customizable with various toppings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Soy sauce or tamari, for serving

steps: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot, combine the rice, ginger, and water or vegetable stock. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 to 1.5 hours, until the rice breaks down and the jook reaches your desired consistency.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, topped with scallions, sesame oil, soy sauce or tamari, and an optional soft-boiled egg.

recipe.name: Tortang Talong (Filipino Eggplant Omelet)
recipe.description: A traditional Filipino dish featuring roasted eggplant dipped in beaten eggs and pan-fried to perfection. Often served with rice and a side of dipping sauce.
steps: Roast the eggplants over an open flame or under a broiler until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft.
Allow the eggplants to cool slightly, then peel off the skin, keeping the stems intact.
Flatten each eggplant gently with a fork, spreading the flesh evenly while keeping it intact.
Season the beaten eggs with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Dip each eggplant into the beaten eggs, coating both sides, then place into the skillet.
Fry until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve hot with rice and your choice of dipping sauce.

recipe.name: Grilled Peach & Apricot Salad
recipe.description: A summer salad featuring caramelized grilled peaches and apricots paired with kale, feta, and prosciutto, topped with a lemon-olive oil dressing.
steps: Preheat the grill to medium heat.

Tear or chop kale into bite-size pieces and place in a large salad bowl. Add a pinch of salt and 1 tablespoon olive oil. Massage the kale until softened. Whisk remaining olive oil and lemon juice for the dressing; set aside.
Brush apricots and peaches lightly with neutral oil. Grill cut side down until caramelized.
Toss the kale with dressing and crumble feta on top. Add prosciutto and warm peaches and apricots, letting their juices seep into the salad.
Serve with crusty bread.

recipe.name: Oyster and Spinach Chowder
recipe.description: A comforting and elegant chowder featuring freshly shucked oysters, creamy potatoes, tender spinach, and a touch of cream for a hearty yet refined dish.

ingredients.ingredient_name: freshly shucked oysters and their liquor
diced onion or thinly sliced leek (white and light green parts only)
baby spinach leaves, thick stems discarded

steps: Combine the oyster liquor, clam juice, and water in a bowl. Set aside.
In a medium soup pot, heat butter and olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the onion or leek until softened. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds more.
Add the reserved broth mixture and potatoes to the pot. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the cream and bring back to a simmer. Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Add the oysters and their juices to the pot. Simmer for 3–4 minutes until the oysters are just cooked.
Season the chowder with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Corn, Bacon, and Clam Stew
recipe.description: A summery one-pot stew featuring smoky bacon, sweet corn, clams, and a hint of bourbon, finished with fresh basil and served with crusty bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: corn, shucked and kernels cut from the cobs
thick slices of country bread, grilled or toasted

steps: Heat olive oil in a large, deep soup pot over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until browned and the fat is rendered.
Stir in smoked paprika and cook for 30 seconds until aromatic.
Add corn kernels and season with salt. Stir and cook for 2 minutes. Add cherry tomatoes, cover, and cook for 5 minutes until tomatoes soften.
Squeeze in the lemon juice and pour in the bourbon. Stir, then turn off the heat.
Nestle the clams into the corn mixture with their mouths facing up. Turn the heat back to medium, cover, and cook until the clams open, 5–10 minutes.
Remove the pot from heat, sprinkle with torn basil leaves, and serve directly from the pot with toasted bread on the side.

recipe.name: Jalapeño Chicken Meatballs
recipe.description: Spiced chicken meatballs with broccoli and a tangy yogurt sauce, baked on a sheet pan for a simple, flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: limes, zested, plus one cut into thin rounds

steps: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Toss broccoli with olive oil, ½ teaspoon cumin, red pepper flakes, and salt. Rub lime rounds in residual oil and scatter everything on a sheet pan.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg and combine with 1 teaspoon cumin, salt, jalapeño, cheese, 3 tablespoons yogurt, breadcrumbs, cilantro, lime zest, and ground chicken. Mix gently.
Shape the mixture into loose 1 ½-inch meatballs (about 20 total). Arrange them on the sheet pan among the broccoli, placing lime rounds on top of some meatballs.
Bake for 15–18 minutes, flipping broccoli halfway through. Broil for 1–2 minutes for more color on the meatballs.
While baking, mix remaining yogurt with lime juice and chopped cilantro. Season with salt.
Serve the meatballs with the yogurt sauce and roasted broccoli.

recipe.name: Spicy Black Bean & Sweet Potato Soup
recipe.description: A hearty vegetarian soup with roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and a medley of spices, perfect for fall or any chilly day.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
red bell pepper, seeded and diced
jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely diced

steps: Preheat oven to 375°F. Toss cubed sweet potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, ½ teaspoon cumin, ½ teaspoon chili powder, and salt. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes. Let cool to room temperature.
In a large pot, heat the remaining olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onion until translucent, about 3–4 minutes.
Add garlic, red pepper, and jalapeño to the pot. Sauté until softened, about 3 minutes.
Stir in vegetable broth, tomatoes, remaining cumin, chili powder, coriander, oregano, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a gentle boil.
Reduce heat to simmer and add roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and corn. Simmer for 20–30 minutes.
Adjust seasoning as needed. Add cayenne or hot sauce if desired for extra heat. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Lemony Pasta With Sardines & Escarole
recipe.description: A quick and zesty pasta dish combining tinned sardines, escarole, lemon, and chile flakes for a light and flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: tinned sardines packed in olive oil
mild chile flakes (Aleppo, Espelette, or gochugaru)
head of escarole or romaine, roughly torn
chopped fresh dill, mint, or basil

steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
While the pasta cooks, drain the oil from the sardine tins into a large bowl. Grate garlic and lemon zest into the bowl, and stir in chile flakes.
Add the cooked pasta to the bowl and toss aggressively to coat in the garlicky oil.
Halve the lemon and squeeze its juice into the bowl. Add torn escarole and chopped herbs, then gently toss to combine.
Add the sardines, breaking them into smaller pieces if desired. Adjust seasoning with salt and chile flakes to taste.
Drizzle with extra olive oil before serving, if desired.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Bacon-Wrapped Chicken With Dates, Arugula & Blue Cheese
recipe.description: Juicy chicken breasts wrapped in crispy bacon, roasted with Medjool dates and topped with a tangy vinaigrette, served alongside a salad of arugula and blue cheese.

ingredients.ingredient_name: chile sauce (harissa, sambal oelek, or gochujang)
arugula, spinach, or other tender greens
crumbled blue cheese, feta, or goat cheese

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (375°F for convection). Arrange an oven rack 6 inches from the broiler.
Mix paprika and coriander. Pat chicken dry, rub spice mix evenly on both sides, and season with salt and pepper.
Wrap each chicken breast with two slices of bacon, overlapping slightly, and tuck ends underneath.
Heat olive oil in a 12-inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Sear bacon-wrapped chicken seam-side down for 4 minutes until browned.
Mix maple syrup and chile sauce. Brush on chicken tops. Nestle dates around the chicken in the skillet.
Roast for 10–20 minutes until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 150°F–155°F, basting with pan sauce occasionally. Remove dates and set aside.
Broil chicken for 2–4 minutes until the bacon crisps. Rest chicken for 5–10 minutes before slicing.
Whisk vinegar into the pan sauce to create a vinaigrette. Toss greens with vinaigrette and top with dates and cheese.
Serve chicken alongside the salad, drizzling extra vinaigrette over the chicken.

recipe.name: Saffron Pasta With White Wine & Cream
recipe.description: A luxurious and quick pasta dish featuring saffron-infused sauce with white wine and cream, perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes (optional)

steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt it generously.
Crush saffron threads gently and steep in hot water for 10–15 minutes.
In a sauté pan, simmer white wine over medium heat until reduced by half, about 3–5 minutes.
Lower the heat to medium-low, then whisk in 2 tablespoons of butter one at a time until emulsified.
Stir in the cream, saffron liquid, and a pinch of salt. Simmer for 2 minutes until slightly thickened. Remove from heat.
Cook pasta according to package instructions or until al dente. If using fresh pasta, cook for 2–3 minutes.
Reheat the sauce and transfer pasta to the pan using tongs. Add the remaining butter and toss to coat. Adjust the consistency with pasta cooking water if needed.
Serve immediately, garnished with Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes if desired.

recipe.name: Rainbow Noodle Bowl With Garlicky-Gingery Broth
recipe.description: A colorful noodle bowl with roasted sweet potatoes, tatsoi, and a flavorful garlicky-ginger broth, garnished with pickled vegetables and a soft egg yolk.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small sweet potato, peeled and sliced into 1/2-inch coins

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss sweet potatoes in olive oil and roast for 15 minutes. Flip the slices and roast for another 5 minutes until tender.
In a medium saucepan, sauté garlic in 1 tablespoon olive oil for 2–3 minutes until fragrant. Add ginger and cook for another 5 minutes.
Deglaze the pan with 1 cup of stock, then add remaining stock and fish sauce. Simmer and adjust seasoning.
Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Add tatsoi to the broth and simmer for 2–3 minutes until wilted.
Separate the egg yolks from the whites. Place each yolk in a small bowl.
Divide broth and tatsoi between two bowls. Add noodles in the center, creating a well for the yolk. Arrange sweet potato and radish slices along the edges.
Top with pickles, chili sauce, and crispy seasoning. Carefully add the yolk to the well and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Tortellini Salad With Zucchini & Roasted Garlic
recipe.description: A refreshing pasta salad combining cheese tortellini, thinly sliced zucchini marinated with roasted garlic, olive oil, and lemon, topped with Parmesan, basil, and pine nuts.
steps: Preheat oven to 350ºF. Cut the top off the garlic bulb, drizzle with ½ tablespoon olive oil, and sprinkle with salt. Roast for 40–60 minutes until soft.
Mash 3–4 roasted garlic cloves in a large bowl. Add 5 tablespoons olive oil, lemon zest, juice, salt, and pepper. Toss zucchini slices in the marinade and let sit for 15 minutes.
Cook tortellini according to package instructions. Drain and let cool slightly.
Combine tortellini, marinated zucchini, Parmesan, basil, and pine nuts in the bowl. Toss to coat evenly.
Garnish with additional basil, Parmesan, and pine nuts if desired. Serve immediately or chill before serving.

recipe.name: Sazón Ramen
recipe.description: A fusion of Latin American and Asian flavors featuring instant ramen with sazón spice blend, shrimp, spinach, and a garlicky sofrito base, topped with soft-boiled eggs and lime.

ingredients.ingredient_name: diced yellow onion (about ¼ small onion)
diced green bell pepper (about ¼ bell pepper)
instant ramen (any variety), seasoning packets reserved

steps: In a medium pot over high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil until shimmering. Pat shrimp dry and season with ¼ teaspoon salt. Sear in batches until lightly browned and pink, about 30 seconds per side. Remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium and add the remaining olive oil, onion, bell pepper, and garlic. Sauté until softened and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add 4 cups of water, sazón, dashi, remaining salt, and half a ramen seasoning packet. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Add ramen noodles and cook per package instructions. Remove from heat and stir in spinach until wilted.
Divide soup into bowls and top with shrimp, cilantro, eggs, and sesame seeds if using. Serve immediately with lime wedges.

recipe.name: Summery Fresh Tomato & Pistachio Pasta
recipe.description: A refreshing pasta dish featuring fresh tomatoes, toasted pistachios, and a garlic-anchovy paste, served at room temperature for a perfect summer meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: very ripe roma tomatoes, cored and chopped

steps: Toss tomatoes with 2 teaspoons of sea salt in a large bowl and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to macerate.
On a cutting board, smash garlic, anchovies, and a pinch of salt into a smooth paste.
Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside in a large serving bowl.

Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely ground. Add macerated tomatoes with their juices, garlic-anchovy paste, and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano. Pulse until the sauce is smooth but slightly textured.
Mix the tomato mixture with olive oil and toss with the pasta until coated.
Serve pasta at room temperature garnished with basil leaves, cracked black pepper, and extra Parmigiano-Reggiano or olive oil if desired.

recipe.name: Ramen Scrambled Eggs
recipe.description: Fluffy scrambled eggs infused with the umami-packed flavor of instant ramen seasoning, perfect on rice, toast, or in a tortilla.

ingredients.ingredient_name: thinly sliced scallions or dried ramen vegetables (for garnish)

steps: Crack the eggs into a medium bowl. Add sugar and vinegar, then whisk with a fork until fully combined and aerated.
Melt butter in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Pour in the ramen seasoning, stirring with a spatula to create a loose paste. Toast the seasoning for about 30 seconds.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook undisturbed until the edges begin to set, about 2 minutes.
Turn off the heat and gently fold the eggs from one side to the other using a rubber spatula, forming fluffy curds. Stop folding when the eggs are slightly glossy.
Transfer to a plate and garnish with scallions or dried ramen vegetables. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Roasted Sweet Potato and Black Bean Salad with Chile Dressing
recipe.description: A warm, vibrant salad featuring roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, bell peppers, and fresh cilantro, tossed with a tangy chile-lime dressing.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Place sweet potatoes and onions on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and roast for 30 minutes, stirring halfway through.
In a blender, combine chile, garlic, lime juice, remaining olive oil, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
In a large bowl, combine roasted vegetables, black beans, bell pepper, and cilantro. Toss with the dressing.
Serve warm, at room temperature, or refrigerate for up to a day.

recipe.name: Tomato, Cucumber, and Fresh Herb Salad
recipe.description: A refreshing and colorful salad with Persian cucumbers, heirloom tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and an herby sherry vinaigrette, perfect as a light side dish or starter.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small Persian cucumbers, sliced into rounds
ball of fresh mozzarella, torn into chunks
additional basil, parsley, and mint, chopped

steps: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, sherry vinegar, lemon juice, shallot, honey, and chopped herbs to make the dressing. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Prepare the salad: Slice cucumbers, heirloom tomatoes, and cherry tomatoes. Tear mozzarella into bite-size pieces.
In a large serving bowl or platter, combine all salad ingredients. Drizzle with the dressing and toss gently to combine.
Top with additional fresh herbs and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Spicy Tomato Beans With ‘Nduja
recipe.description: A quick and hearty dish featuring creamy butter beans in a velvety, spicy tomato sauce flavored with ‘Nduja salami, Parmesan, and heavy cream. Perfect for midweek dinners.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ‘Nduja salami, more or less to taste
cans of butter beans, drained and rinsed

steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté garlic and shallot for about 2 minutes until fragrant and translucent.
Add salt, black pepper, Italian seasoning, and tomato paste. Stir to combine. Add ‘Nduja and mix until melted and evenly incorporated.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan until smooth and creamy.
Add butter beans and mix thoroughly. Sprinkle with lemon juice and simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens and becomes glossy.
Garnish with parsley and serve with freshly grated Parmesan and crusty bread.

recipe.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken Pasta
recipe.description: A comforting dish combining creamy Alfredo sauce, fresh basil pesto, and crispy seared chicken, tossed with pasta for a flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
grated Parmesan, plus extra for serving

steps: Cook pasta in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of cooking water.
To make the pesto, blend basil, pine nuts, Parmesan, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending until combined but slightly textured.
Heat olive oil and half the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, season with salt and pepper, and cook for about 5 minutes until browned. Remove from skillet.

Add remaining butter to the skillet. Sauté garlic for 2 minutes. Pour in cream, bring to a boil, and stir to dissolve browned bits. Add pesto, cooked chicken, and Parmesan. Stir until cheese is melted. Add reserved pasta water if needed to thin the sauce.
Toss in pasta until evenly coated. Serve with grated Parmesan and toasted pine nuts if desired.

recipe.name: Eggplant Halloumi Stir-Fry
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful stir-fry with creamy eggplant, chewy halloumi, and a savory soy-ginger sauce, perfect for serving over noodles or rice.
steps: Cook the noodles according to package directions. Prepare all ingredients before starting the stir-fry.
Combine cornstarch, soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice vinegar, lemon juice, water, brown sugar, sesame oil, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes in a small bowl to make the sauce.
Heat 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking-hot. Stir-fry the eggplant until browned and crisp-tender, about 6 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Heat the remaining oil in the same wok. Stir-fry the halloumi cubes until browned, about 2 minutes. Add garlic, onion, ginger, and sesame seeds. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Return the eggplant to the wok and pour in the sauce. Toss frequently for 1–2 minutes until well coated. Add basil leaves and stir until wilted, about 30 seconds.
Mix in the cooked noodles, toss to coat evenly, and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Chinese Tomato & Egg Dough Drop Soup (Geda Tang)
recipe.description: A simple yet comforting Northern Chinese soup featuring velvety broth, dough drops, tomatoes, eggs, and garnished with cilantro and chili oil.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cilantro leaves (or extra scallions), loosely packed

steps: In a small bowl, mix the flour and warm water with chopsticks until smooth and slightly runny. Set aside.
Whisk eggs in a separate bowl until yolks and whites are fully incorporated.
Bring chicken stock to a rolling boil in a small pot.

Heat oil in another medium pot until smoking. Add scrambled eggs, stir quickly, and let them bubble for about 20 seconds. Before the eggs fully set, pour the boiling stock into the pot to create a bubbling, emulsified soup base.
Add tomatoes and scallions to the soup. Season with salt, sugar, MSG, and white pepper. Simmer for 2 minutes.
With the soup simmering, use a ladle and slotted spoon to drop the wet dough through a colander or spoon into the soup to form small dumplings. Bring to a boil and cook until dough is fully cooked.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro leaves and a drizzle of chili oil.

recipe.name: Chopped Salad With Chicken, Peach & Feta
recipe.description: A fresh and flavorful chopped salad featuring grilled chicken, ripe peaches, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and crumbled feta, tossed with a simple red wine vinaigrette.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Boar’s Head FireSmith™ Flame Grilled Chicken Breast, cut into strips
cherry tomatoes, cut into small cubes
English cucumber or Persian cucumbers, cut into small cubes
avocado, peeled, halved, pitted, and cubed

steps: Heat a large sauté pan or cast-iron skillet. Cook bacon until crisp, about 10–12 minutes. Allow bacon to cool, then crumble into ½-inch pieces.
Prepare the vinaigrette: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper, and oregano until emulsified.
In a large mixing bowl, combine lettuce, chicken, bacon, peaches, cucumber, avocado, tomatoes, and feta. Gently toss using tongs.
Drizzle the salad with vinaigrette and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Seaweed (Wakame) Colorful Confetti Salad with Sweet Black Sesame Dressing
recipe.description: A vibrant, healthy salad featuring rehydrated wakame seaweed, crisp vegetables, and a sweet, nutty black sesame dressing.
steps: Rehydrate the wakame seaweed by soaking it in warm water for 10 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water.
In a large bowl, combine the rehydrated wakame, julienned carrots, cucumber, and red bell pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, and sesame oil to create the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Garnish with toasted black sesame seeds before serving.

recipe.name: Classic Chicken Piccata
recipe.description: A classic Italian-American dish featuring tender chicken breast cutlets cooked in a zesty lemon-butter caper sauce. This light and flavorful dish is perfect for a quick weeknight meal or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Boneless, skinless chicken breasts, trimmed and pounded until 1/4 inch thick
Couscous or angel hair pasta (for serving)

steps: Cut one lemon in half lengthwise. Trim the ends from one half and cut across into thin slices about 1/8 inch thick; set aside. Juice the remaining half and whole lemon to obtain about 1/4 cup juice; set aside.
Season both sides of the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper. Place flour into a shallow dish or pan. Coat each breast with flour, and shake to remove excess.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat until hot, about 2 minutes. Cook half the batch in the skillet without moving them until lightly browned on the first side, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Turn and cook until the second side is lightly browned, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes longer. Transfer to a plate kept warm in the oven, or cover with aluminum foil. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the skillet and heat until shimmering. Add remaining chicken pieces and repeat. Add cooked chicken to previous batch and keep warm in 200-degree oven.

Using the pan in which you cooked the chicken, sauté the shallots in the oil and browned bits remaining in the pan. Once shallots become translucent, add the chicken broth and lemon slices. Allow to cook until lemon slices are well-softened.

Add the capers and lemon juice, and allow to reduce to concentrate flavors. Remove pan from heat and swirl in the butter until it melts and thickens the sauce. Swirl in the parsley. Spoon over chicken and serve immediately over a bed of couscous or angel hair pasta.

recipe.name: Chickpea, Pumpkin, and Sage Stew
recipe.description: A hearty and comforting one-dish meal featuring chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and fresh sage. This cozy autumnal stew is easy to prepare with pantry staples and is perfect for chilly evenings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Ditalini, tubetti, or other small pasta like orzo

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped carrot, onion, and sage leaves. Sauté until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and chicken broth. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Add the pasta and cook until tender, about 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

recipe.name: Nik Sharma's Spicy Chocolate Chip–Hazelnut Cookies
recipe.description: A one-bowl, crisp-chewy cookie that is gluten-free, with hazelnut flour, jaggery, bittersweet chocolate, and a kick of black pepper. Inspired by Nutella, this cookie balances spicy, nutty, and chocolate flavors.
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the hazelnut meal, jaggery, baking powder, baking soda, black pepper, and salt.
