Add the egg, melted butter, hazelnut extract, chocolate, and ginger, and stir with a large wooden spoon until the dough comes together.
Grease your hands with a little oil to prevent the dough from sticking. Divide the dough into twelve equal parts and shape them into balls. Flatten them into 2-inch (5 cm) rounds.
Place the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Wrap the entire baking sheet tightly in plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 10 minutes, preferably 2 hours.
To bake, preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a second baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove the baking sheet from the freezer and put half the rounds of dough on the second sheet. Spread out the rounds on both baking sheets and refrigerate one of them.
Bake one batch of cookies at a time until golden brown, about 12 to 15 minutes. Cool completely on wire racks.

recipe.name: Scrambled Red Shakshuka from Sami Tamimi & Tara Wigley
recipe.description: A bright, saucy scrambled egg dish inspired by Sami Tamimi's childhood in Palestine. Eggs are gently scrambled into a base of red bell pepper and tomatoes, creating a comforting and flavorful shakshuka that's perfect for breakfast or brunch.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Aleppo chile flakes or red pepper flakes
Coriander seeds, lightly toasted and crushed
Yellow or white onion, thinly sliced
Red bell pepper, seeded and cut into long slices
Cumin seeds, lightly toasted and crushed
Salt and black pepper to taste

steps: Place the feta in a bowl with parsley, 1/2 teaspoon of chile flakes, 3 tablespoons of oil, and 1/2 teaspoon of coriander seeds. Mix well and set aside.
Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a large sauté pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes, until softened and lightly browned.
Add the bell pepper and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the garlic, cumin seeds, tomato paste, paprika, and the remaining coriander seeds. Cook for another 1 minute until fragrant.
Add all the tomatoes, shatta, water, 1 teaspoon of salt, and a generous grind of black pepper. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes until the tomatoes break down and the sauce thickens.
Add salt and pepper to the eggs and mix well. Slowly pour the eggs into the tomato mixture, swirling the pan and folding gently. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pan, and cook for 4 minutes.
Remove from heat, spoon the marinated feta on top, sprinkle with remaining chile flakes, and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Gochujang-Yogurt Chicken with Garlic Butter Rice
recipe.description: A tangy, spicy chicken dish with creamy garlic butter rice, combining gochujang-marinated chicken with savory garlic rice for a perfect, flavorful meal.
steps: In a bowl, combine the gochujang, yogurt, and 3 cloves of minced garlic. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.

In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the remaining clove of minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in the chicken stock, bring to a simmer, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit, covered, for 10 minutes.

Preheat the broiler and set a rack 6 inches from the heat. Line a baking sheet with foil and set a wire rack on top. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place on the rack. Broil for 5 to 7 minutes per side, until charred and cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise and lemon juice. Thin with a little water, if needed, to reach a drizzly consistency.
To serve, divide the rice among plates. Top with lettuce leaves, cherry tomatoes, and the broiled chicken. Drizzle with the lemon-mayo sauce.

recipe.name: Stir-Fried Udon with Bacon, Parmesan & Gochujang
recipe.description: A fusion dish combining elements from Korean, Japanese, and Italian cuisines. This stir-fried udon features thick-cut bacon, gochujang, Parmesan, and egg yolks for a savory, spicy, and creamy pasta experience.
steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the udon.
In a skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat. Add the bacon, scallions, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Saute until the bacon is golden brown.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks, Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Lower the skillet heat, add soy sauce and gochujang, and stir to coat the bacon mixture.
Cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and add the noodles to the skillet. Toss to combine with the bacon and gochujang sauce.
Mix 2-3 tablespoons of the reserved udon water into the egg-cheese mixture to form a sauce. Add the udon and toss to coat.
Season with more salt and pepper if needed, drizzle with sesame oil, and serve garnished with scallions.

recipe.name: Best Chicken Stew
recipe.description: A hearty chicken stew made with tender Yukon gold potatoes, carrots, celery, and seasoned chicken, simmered in a rich broth of rosemary, thyme, and garlic. Perfect for cold-weather comfort meals.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
Yukon gold potatoes, cut into bite-sized pieces

steps: Heat oil in a large pot. Sear the chicken until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Remove and cut into bite-sized pieces.
In the same pot, cook onion and garlic for about 3 minutes until softened. Add the rosemary and thyme, cooking for another 2 minutes.
Add carrots and celery, cooking until translucent, about 8 minutes.
Stir in the flour and cook for 3 minutes to coat the vegetables. Gradually add the chicken stock, stirring to break up lumps of flour.
Add the chicken, potatoes, and pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce to medium-low, and simmer for about 20 minutes until the chicken and potatoes are tender.
Adjust seasonings and discard the thyme and rosemary sprigs. Garnish with parsley and serve.

recipe.name: White Bean and Kale Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A hearty soup made with white beans, tender kale, and savory sausage, this comforting dish is perfect for cold days. Flavored with rosemary, garlic, and a splash of white wine, it's a nourishing meal that’s easy to make and packed with flavor.
steps: Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the shallots and sauté until almost translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic, carrots, and mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour in the white wine and let it reduce slightly. Add the vegetable stock, beans, and rosemary. Bring to a boil, then add the chopped kale. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
While the soup cooks, brown the sausage in a separate pan. If using crumbled sausage, add it directly to the soup. For linked sausage, slice and stir into the soup.
Taste the soup and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Serve topped with grated Parmesan and crusty bread.

recipe.name: Vegetarian Mushroom Thyme Gravy
recipe.description: A rich and savory vegetarian gravy made with dried mushrooms, fresh thyme, and a touch of sherry. Perfect for topping mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, or even as a sauce for vegetarian mains.
steps: Bring the vegetable stock to a boil and pour it over the dried mushrooms. Let them soak for 20 minutes, then remove the mushrooms and mince or slice them thinly, reserving the stock.
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter and sauté the shallot for about 5 minutes until softened.
Add the flour to the butter and shallots, stirring constantly for 2 minutes to cook the flour.
Gradually stir in 1 1/2 cups of the reserved mushroom stock. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the minced mushrooms, soy sauce, cream, sherry, and thyme. Cook until heated through and thickened to the desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipe.name: Punjabi-Style Chicken Curry
recipe.description: A robust and flavorful chicken curry with rich spices like garam masala, turmeric, and chili powder. The chicken is marinated in yogurt and cooked to perfection in a tomato and onion base.
steps: Marinate the chicken in yogurt, salt, spices, garlic, and ginger. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and bay leaf. Once they start to sizzle, add the onions and cook until golden brown, about 15 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Stir in the ground spices and cook for 1 minute.
Add the marinated chicken and mix well. Cover and cook over low heat for 40-45 minutes, until the chicken is fully cooked and tender.
Let the curry rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour to enhance the flavors. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve.

recipe.name: Honey Mustard Chicken
recipe.description: A classic honey-mustard chicken dish that balances sweetness and tang. Perfect for a simple weeknight meal or dressed up for guests. Serve with fresh corn panzanella for a complete meal.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Mix all the marinade ingredients (olive oil to red pepper flakes) in a bowl.
Coat the chicken breast with the marinade, cover, and let rest for 10 minutes or overnight.
Heat oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken for 2-3 minutes on one side, then flip and transfer to the oven.
Bake for 15-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve with fresh corn panzanella for a balanced meal.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Farro with Fennel, Tomatoes & Parmesan
recipe.description: A savory and aromatic dish that combines nutty farro with sweet fennel, cherry tomatoes, and a touch of anchovy. Finished with a bright fennel frond pesto and Parmesan, it’s a simple, flavorful one-pan meal.
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the anchovy and stir until it dissolves into the oil. Add the farro and fry for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.

Add the stock, lemon zest, fennel, garlic, cherry tomatoes, salt, and chile flakes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 25 minutes until the farro is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
While the farro is cooking, make the fennel frond pesto: chop fennel fronds with pine nuts and Parmesan, then mix with olive oil and lemon juice.
Once the farro is done, spoon the fennel frond pesto over the top while still in the skillet. Garnish with more Parmesan and serve warm.

recipe.name: Orecchiette With Bacony Collards & Cannellini Beans
recipe.description: A hearty pasta with orecchiette, bacon-cooked collards, and cannellini beans. This one-pot dish features tender greens, creamy beans, and a unique pasta-soaking technique, making it easy to prepare.
steps: Cover the pasta in 1.5 cups of stock, stirring occasionally to prevent clumping.
Add bacon and 2 tbsp water to a Dutch oven. Cook over medium heat until bacon is browned and crisp, 12-15 mins.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes to bacon fat, cooking until aromatic. Add collards, remaining stock, salt, and pepper.
Simmer partially covered until greens are tender, 40-45 mins. Add beans, adjust seasoning.
Add soaked pasta and its liquid, simmer until al dente, 3-5 mins.
Remove from heat, add Parmesan, butter, and bacon, stir well. Serve garnished with more cheese.

recipe.name: Creamy Tortellini Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A rich and comforting soup with cheese tortellini, Italian sausage, bell pepper, and a creamy tomato broth. Perfect for a cozy meal.
steps: Heat oil and butter in a pot over medium heat. Add bell pepper, sauté for 5 minutes.
Add shallots and garlic, cook for 2 minutes.
Add sausage, oregano, sage, paprika, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Break up the meat and cook until browned, 5 minutes.
Add chicken broth, tomato paste, and puréed tomatoes. Cook for 15 minutes.
Add tortellini, cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cream and Parmesan. Simmer for 1 minute, adjust seasoning, and serve with thyme.

recipe.name: Tahini-Rubbed Chicken With Chickpeas & Dates
recipe.description: An easy one-skillet meal with tahini-rubbed chicken, caramelized dates, chickpeas, and lemon. Perfect for a savory, sticky pan sauce with Middle Eastern flavors.
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Mix tahini, olive oil, honey, cumin, and paprika in a small bowl until smooth.
Rub chicken with tahini mixture, season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix honey and hot water; soak lemon slices.
Layer onion, chickpeas, half the lemon slices, and oil in a skillet; season.
Add chicken, arrange remaining lemon around it. Roast for 20 minutes.
Add dates around chicken, roast another 15-20 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F.
Broil for crisp skin if desired. Stir herbs into chickpeas and onions.
Combine yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, and salt.
Serve chicken and dates with chickpeas, yogurt sauce, and flatbread.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Chicken With Tomato and Turmeric Rice
recipe.description: A flavorful one-skillet meal with tender chicken thighs, spiced rice, and tomatoes. This recipe combines warming spices and is perfect for easy weeknight dinners.
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Season chicken with salt, pepper, coriander, cumin, and paprika.
Heat olive oil in an ovenproof skillet. Sear chicken until golden, about 5 minutes per side. Set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic, add rice and turmeric. Toast rice for 3 minutes.
Add tomato paste, chopped tomatoes, stock, and remaining salt. Simmer.
Return chicken, cover, and bake for 30-35 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

recipe.name: Miso-Ginger Noodles With Tuna & Spicy Sesame Crumbs
recipe.description: Saucy, umami-rich noodles with tender greens, canned tuna, and a topping of spicy sesame crumbs. Quick to make and deeply flavorful.
steps: Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Cook noodles per package instructions; drain.
Prepare the dressing by mixing miso, warm water, ginger, vinegar, oils, and soy sauce in a bowl.
Toss noodles with 3/4 of the dressing, greens, and tuna. Add remaining dressing if desired.
In a skillet, heat oil and toast panko, sesame seeds, and red pepper flakes until golden. Sprinkle with salt.
Serve noodles topped with sesame crumbs.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Vegetable Beef Soup
recipe.description: A comforting Instant Pot soup with ground beef, vegetables, and spices, perfect for cozy weeknights.
steps: In the Instant Pot, turn on the Sauté function, add olive oil, and sauté ground beef until browned. Add onion and garlic, cooking another 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, soy sauce, oregano, celery seed, and bay leaves. Cook briefly until fragrant.
Add carrots, beef stock, and diced tomatoes. Lock the lid and pressure cook on high for 20 minutes.
After cooking, stir in peas and green beans, letting them heat through. Add vinegar, adjust salt and pepper, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe.name: Mole Sencillo
recipe.description: A simplified yet flavorful mole sauce made with ancho chiles, nuts, and chocolate for a rich, smoky, and slightly sweet taste.
steps: Char tomato and onion in a hot skillet until blackened on all sides.
Heat lard, fry chiles until toasted, and set aside. Fry crackers, almonds, raisins, sesame seeds, and anise until golden and aromatic.
Add salt, sugar, water, chiles, crackers, tomato, and onion; simmer for 30 minutes.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Reheat blended mole in lard, stir in chocolate, and adjust seasoning. Serve with toasted sesame seeds.

recipe.name: Burnt Broccoli Farro with Smashed Olives
recipe.description: Nutty farro with charred broccoli, smashed olives, feta, and a tahini-lime dressing for a Mediterranean-inspired meal.
steps: Cook farro in salted water until tender; drain.
Pickle red onion in lime juice with salt.
Char broccoli and olives in oil, season with pepper flakes.
Mix lime juice, tahini, and oil for dressing. Toss with farro, broccoli, olives, and feta. Top with pickled onions.

recipe.name: Chicken Florentine by Joanna Gaines
recipe.description: A classic one-skillet Chicken Florentine with creamy sauce, spinach, and a hint of lemon.
steps: Heat olive oil in skillet, season chicken with pepper and 2 tsp salt, dredge in flour.
Cook chicken until golden, about 8 mins per side, then set aside.
Reduce heat, melt butter, add shallots and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add wine, simmer to reduce by half, then add cream, cooking until thickened.
Stir in spinach and remaining salt until wilted.
Slice chicken, return to skillet, garnish with parsley and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: One-Pan Crispy Chicken Thighs With Roasted Potatoes, Zucchini & Tomatoes
recipe.description: A simple and flavorful one-pan meal with crispy chicken thighs, golden potatoes, and caramelized summer vegetables.
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F. Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add chicken skin-side down to skillet and cook until golden, about 8-10 minutes. Flip and cook for 5 minutes on the other side. Remove from skillet.
Add potatoes to the skillet and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden.
Add zucchini and cook for 5 minutes until it begins to caramelize.
Add tomatoes, garlic, and oregano, stirring gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
Return chicken to the skillet, place in the oven, and roast for 10 minutes, or until chicken reaches 165°F.
Garnish with remaining oregano and optional lemon juice.

recipe.name: Herby Mushroom Stew
recipe.description: A vegetarian-friendly stew with golden-brown mushrooms cooked in a rich broth with red wine, soy sauce, and aromatic spices. Perfect served over rice or mashed potatoes.
steps: Heat 1/4 cup of olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Working in batches, add mushrooms and cook without stirring until golden-brown. Transfer to a bowl and repeat with remaining mushrooms.
Add remaining olive oil to the pot. Lower heat to medium, then add shallots and carrot, cooking until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and tomato paste, cooking for 3 minutes until fragrant. Stir in flour, coating vegetables, and cook for 2 minutes.

Add cooked mushrooms back to the pot along with red wine, stock, soy sauce, smoked paprika, hot or sweet paprika, coriander, and balsamic vinegar. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 50-60 minutes until thickened.
Season with kosher salt, garnish with parsley, and serve over rice, mashed potatoes, or couscous.

recipe.name: Jean's Kimchi Fried Rice with Nori
recipe.description: A comforting kimchi fried rice made with crispy Spam, ripe kimchi, and a topping of crushed nori. Served with a runny fried egg for the ultimate savory meal.
steps: Heat sesame oil in a large nonstick pan or wok over medium heat.
Add diced Spam and cook until crispy, then add kimchi (reserve juice) and sauté until fragrant and darker in color.
Add rice, breaking it up with a spoon, and pour in kimchi juice, soy sauce, and additional oil if needed. Stir continuously for 5-10 minutes until well-combined and slightly toasted.
Mix in crushed seaweed, then serve each portion with a fried egg on top.

recipe.name: Cheesy Potato Soup with Peppered Scallions
recipe.description: A comforting, creamy potato soup topped with sharp cheese and a peppery, charred scallion garnish for added flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: crème fraîche, sour cream, or Greek yogurt

steps: Melt butter in a stockpot over medium heat. Sauté onions for 5 minutes until translucent, then add garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. Sprinkle in flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 2-3 minutes.
Add cubed potatoes, milk, vegetable stock, salt, rosemary, and thyme. Simmer on medium-low heat for 25-30 minutes until potatoes are fork-tender.

For the peppered scallion topping, coat scallions in olive oil and char them in a hot skillet, about 5 minutes. Remove, cool, and roughly chop. Toast butter in the skillet until browned, then add scallions, lemon zest, juice, and salt. Sizzle for 2 minutes and season with black pepper.
Remove herb stems from the soup, set aside a quarter of the potatoes, and blend the rest until smooth. Add the reserved potatoes for texture.
Stir in cheeses, smoked paprika, cayenne, and adjust salt. Serve with crème fraîche or sour cream and a spoonful of peppered scallions.

recipe.name: Giambotta (Italian Summer Vegetable Stew)
recipe.description: A traditional Italian vegetable stew made with summer produce like potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes. Perfect for using up fresh garden vegetables.

ingredients.ingredient_name: white or yellow onion, finely chopped

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, and cook until browned.
Add potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, green beans, and bell pepper. Stir to coat with oil.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and broth, stir, and cover. Simmer for about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.
Add cherry tomatoes and basil. Stir and cook uncovered for 2-3 minutes to let the tomatoes soften.
Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve hot or cold with grated cheese and day-old bread, if desired.

recipe.name: Weeknight Cassoulet
recipe.description: A simplified, quick take on traditional cassoulet, featuring Italian sausages, canned beans, and a crispy breadcrumb topping. Perfect for a cozy weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cans of cannellini or white northern beans (undrained)

steps: Heat 2 tbsp of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Prick sausages with a knife and cook, turning occasionally, until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board.
Add onion, celery, and garlic to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper, cooking until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add beans with their liquid, water, and additional salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer. Slice sausages and return to the skillet, then stir in vinegar and remove from heat.
Preheat the broiler with the rack in the top position. In a small bowl, mix panko, parsley, remaining 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Scatter over beans and sausage.
Broil until the top is golden brown, 1-2 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Porcini Mushroom Risotto
recipe.description: A creamy, savory risotto featuring fresh porcini mushrooms, Parmesan, and a touch of white wine. Perfect for cozy fall dinners.
steps: In a medium skillet over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp of olive oil with garlic. Once garlic is golden, add mushrooms and cook until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add salt midway through. Discard garlic, set mushrooms aside.
In a pan, heat remaining olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, cooking until softened, about 10 minutes without browning.
Add rice, stirring to coat, then cook until rice is translucent, about 2 minutes. Add wine, stirring until evaporated.
Add 1 cup of broth, stirring until absorbed. Repeat with another cup, then 1/2 cup, cooking until rice is nearly al dente.
Stir in mushrooms, cooking until rice is fully cooked but retains some bite, about 3-5 minutes. Add extra broth if needed.
Remove from heat, stir in Parmesan and butter. Season to taste and garnish with parsley if desired.

recipe.name: Cajun Chicken & Rice
recipe.description: A flavorful one-pot Cajun chicken and rice dish featuring a homemade spice blend, cooked with chicken thighs, bell peppers, onions, and celery for a satisfying meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small green bell pepper, seeded and chopped

steps: In a small bowl, mix paprika, salt, oregano, thyme, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, and red pepper flakes to make the Cajun seasoning.
In another bowl, combine 1 tbsp of Cajun seasoning with 1 tsp olive oil to make a paste. Rub the paste onto the chicken thighs.
In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the remaining oil. Sear chicken, skin-side down, until golden, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté onion, bell pepper, and celery with butter, seasoning with salt and pepper. Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Stir in 1 tbsp Cajun seasoning, then add broth and rice. Bring to a simmer, place chicken on top, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes until rice is tender.
Fluff rice with a fork, garnish with parsley and scallions, and serve.

recipe.name: Brothy Tomato Pasta with White Fish, Shallots & Capers
recipe.description: A light, brothy pasta with cherry tomatoes, white fish, and a crispy caper topping. Perfect for a fresh, seaside-inspired meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: colatura di alici or fish sauce (optional)
mezzi paccheri or other tubular pasta
skinless white fish (e.g., Pollock), cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: For the topping, heat ¼ cup of olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallots, cooking until browned, about 5 minutes. Add capers, cook 1 minute, then stir in 1 tbsp parsley and red pepper flakes. Set aside.
In a large sauté pan over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp olive oil. Add tomatoes, salt, and pepper, cooking until softened, 8-10 minutes.
Add tomato paste, cooking 1 minute. Deglaze with wine, if using, and reduce by half, 3-5 minutes. Add 2 cups of water, simmer for 10 minutes, then add fish sauce to taste.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until just shy of al dente.
Season fish with salt and pepper, add to the broth, and cook over low heat for 4 minutes, flipping once.
Add pasta to the pan, stirring to combine with the broth and breaking up the fish into flakes. Simmer for 1-2 minutes.
Serve pasta with caper topping, remaining parsley, and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Chili Con Carne
recipe.description: A deeply flavorful beef chili made with achiote paste, jalapeños, and kidney beans, cooked to tender perfection in an Instant Pot.

ingredients.ingredient_name: minced shallots, plus more for topping
lime juice, plus more to taste
dried kidney beans, soaked 4 hours, then rinsed

steps: Season beef cubes with salt and pepper. Turn Instant Pot to sauté mode and heat 1 tbsp butter until foaming. Brown half the beef, then remove with a slotted spoon. Repeat with remaining butter and beef.
Add shallots, jalapeños, and 2 tsp kosher salt to the Instant Pot. Sauté until shallots are translucent, about 3 minutes.
Make a well in the center and add achiote paste and tomato paste. Sauté for 1 minute, breaking up the paste. Add water to deglaze, scraping up browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, lime juice, brown sugar, kidney beans, and browned beef. Mix well.
Set the Instant Pot to pressure cook on high for 35 minutes. Allow pressure to release naturally for at least 5 minutes, then quick-release.
Shred the beef with two forks. Adjust seasoning with additional lime juice or salt if needed. Serve with desired toppings like grated cheese, sour cream, or chopped green onions.

recipe.name: Baked Eggs with Mushrooms and Gruyere
recipe.description: A rich and comforting dish of eggs baked with sautéed mushrooms, cream, and Gruyere cheese, creating a perfect balance of creamy and savory flavors.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat, then add the mushrooms and sauté until soft and browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Crack the eggs into small ramekins or a baking dish.
Spoon the mushroom mixture evenly over the eggs.
Sprinkle the grated Gruyere cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the eggs are set but still soft in the center.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste, and garnish with thyme before serving.

recipe.name: Chickpea, Spinach, and Chorizo Frittata
recipe.description: A savory, spicy, and hearty frittata combining chickpeas, spinach, and chorizo, perfect for a full meal or as a tapas dish.
steps: Heat the oil in a 10-inch frying pan with a heatproof handle. Add the chorizo and cook over low heat until the fat begins to run.
Add the chickpeas and spinach and cook gently for a few minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs with the milk, paprika, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour this over the chickpeas and spinach mixture.
Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes, or until the frittata is set but still slightly runny on top.
Meanwhile, heat the broiler to high.
Place the frying pan under the broiler for 2-3 minutes until the top is just set and lightly browned.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipe.name: Tomato-y, Yogurt-y Shakshuka
recipe.description: A flavorful North African dish featuring eggs poached in a spicy tomato and red pepper sauce, enhanced with dollops of yogurt for added tanginess.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Canned diced or crushed tomatoes (28-ounce can)

steps: In a large saucepan over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the harissa, tomato paste, red peppers, garlic, cumin, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Sauté for about 10 minutes, until the peppers soften.
Add the canned tomatoes, bring to a gentle simmer, and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Make six little dips in the sauce. Gently break the eggs and carefully pour each into its own dip. Simmer gently for 8 to 10 minutes, until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Remove from heat, let it settle for a couple of minutes, then spoon into individual plates. Serve with dollops of labneh or Greek yogurt.

recipe.name: Spanish-ish Tortilla in Cast Iron
recipe.description: A hearty Spanish-inspired tortilla combining potatoes and onions, cooked in a cast-iron skillet and finished with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese.

ingredients.ingredient_name: White or Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled

steps: Place the potatoes in a medium pot. Cover with water, season with about a tablespoon of salt, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are just tender when prodded with a fork, 20 to 25 minutes. Drain and let cool, then cut into 1/8-inch slices and put them in a large mixing bowl.

Heat the oven to 400°F. Warm 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add the onions, season with salt, and cook until translucent and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Scrape the onions into the bowl with the potatoes.

Lightly whisk the eggs until smooth, then add them to the potatoes and onions, and gently fold everything together. The potatoes should not be sticking together—make sure the egg separates each slice. Season with salt and pepper and fold once more.

Set a large nonstick or well-seasoned cast-iron pan over medium-high heat. Add the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil and the butter. When the butter foams, pour in the potato-and-egg mixture and pat it down so it's even on the top. Sprinkle the cheese on top, let the eggs set around the edges, and transfer the pan to the oven. Bake until the eggs are almost set in the middle and the tortilla is browned around the edges, about 20 minutes.

Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool on the stovetop. Run a thin spatula or knife around the edge of the tortilla to loosen it, then invert it onto a plate (this may be a 2-person job). If you'd like to serve the tortilla warm, invert it while it's still warm. Slice and serve. If you'd like to serve it with garlic mayonnaise, I won't argue.

recipe.name: Moroccan Merguez Ragout with Poached Eggs
recipe.description: A spicy and flavorful Moroccan-inspired ragout featuring merguez sausage and poached eggs, simmered in a rich tomato sauce infused with aromatic spices.
steps: Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil and cook the merguez sausage until browned, breaking it up with a wooden spoon. Remove the sausage and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the onion and garlic. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the paprika and cumin, cooking for 1 minute to toast the spices.
Add the crushed tomatoes and cooked sausage to the skillet. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Make four small wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well. Cover the skillet and cook until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny, about 6 to 8 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipe.name: Slow-Cooked Tuscan Kale with Pancetta, Bread Crumbs, and a Poached Egg
recipe.description: A hearty and flavorful dish featuring slow-cooked Tuscan kale enriched with crispy pancetta and toasted bread crumbs, topped with a perfectly poached egg.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Tuscan kale, ribs removed, leaves roughly chopped

steps: In a large sauté pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and the minced garlic. Sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the chopped kale and chicken stock. Cover the pan and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, until the kale is tender, about 20 minutes.
Season the kale with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the crispy pancetta.
Divide the kale mixture among serving plates. Top each plate with a poached egg and sprinkle with toasted bread crumbs. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Boosted Jook
recipe.description: A comforting Chinese rice soup, also known as congee, simmered with fresh ginger and customizable with various toppings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Soy sauce or tamari, for serving

steps: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot, combine the rice, ginger, and water or vegetable stock. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 to 1.5 hours, until the rice breaks down and the jook reaches your desired consistency.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, topped with scallions, sesame oil, soy sauce or tamari, and an optional soft-boiled egg.

recipe.name: Creamy Coconut Milk Millet Pudding
recipe.description: A rich and creamy pudding made with lightly toasted millet and coconut milk, scented with vanilla, cinnamon, and almond extract. Perfect for breakfast or dessert.
steps: Lightly toast the millet in a dry saucepan over medium heat until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the coconut milk, water, vanilla extract, and cinnamon stick to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 25 minutes, or until the millet is tender and the mixture is creamy.
Remove the cinnamon stick and stir in the maple syrup. Adjust seasoning with salt, if needed.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with toasted coconut flakes.

recipe.name: Spaghetti with Fried Eggs and Pangrattato for One
recipe.description: A simple yet luxurious dish of spaghetti topped with runny fried eggs, garlic, capers, and crunchy pangrattato (breadcrumbs). Perfect for a solo dinner that's both comforting and quick.
steps: Cook spaghetti in a pot of salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving some of the cooking liquid.
In a pan, heat olive oil and butter. Add garlic and fry the eggs, ensuring the whites set while the yolks remain runny.
Toss the cooked pasta with the fried eggs, parsley, capers, and garlic. Add some of the reserved cooking water for a creamier consistency if needed.
Serve the pasta with grated Pecorino Romano and top with crunchy pangrattato.

recipe.name: Stir-Fried Udon with Bacon, Parmesan & Gochujang
recipe.description: A fusion dish combining elements from Korean, Japanese, and Italian cuisines. This stir-fried udon features thick-cut bacon, gochujang, Parmesan, and egg yolks for a savory, spicy, and creamy pasta experience.
steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the udon.
In a skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat. Add the bacon, scallions, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Saute until the bacon is golden brown.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks, Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Lower the skillet heat, add soy sauce and gochujang, and stir to coat the bacon mixture.
Cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and add the noodles to the skillet. Toss to combine with the bacon and gochujang sauce.
Mix 2-3 tablespoons of the reserved udon water into the egg-cheese mixture to form a sauce. Add the udon and toss to coat.
Season with more salt and pepper if needed, drizzle with sesame oil, and serve garnished with scallions.

recipe.name: Orecchiette With Bacony Collards & Cannellini Beans
recipe.description: A hearty pasta with orecchiette, bacon-cooked collards, and cannellini beans. This one-pot dish features tender greens, creamy beans, and a unique pasta-soaking technique, making it easy to prepare.
steps: Cover the pasta in 1.5 cups of stock, stirring occasionally to prevent clumping.
Add bacon and 2 tbsp water to a Dutch oven. Cook over medium heat until bacon is browned and crisp, 12-15 mins.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes to bacon fat, cooking until aromatic. Add collards, remaining stock, salt, and pepper.
Simmer partially covered until greens are tender, 40-45 mins. Add beans, adjust seasoning.
Add soaked pasta and its liquid, simmer until al dente, 3-5 mins.
Remove from heat, add Parmesan, butter, and bacon, stir well. Serve garnished with more cheese.

recipe.name: Miso-Ginger Noodles With Tuna & Spicy Sesame Crumbs
recipe.description: Saucy, umami-rich noodles with tender greens, canned tuna, and a topping of spicy sesame crumbs. Quick to make and deeply flavorful.
steps: Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Cook noodles per package instructions; drain.
Prepare the dressing by mixing miso, warm water, ginger, vinegar, oils, and soy sauce in a bowl.
Toss noodles with 3/4 of the dressing, greens, and tuna. Add remaining dressing if desired.
In a skillet, heat oil and toast panko, sesame seeds, and red pepper flakes until golden. Sprinkle with salt.
Serve noodles topped with sesame crumbs.

recipe.name: Brothy Tomato Pasta with White Fish, Shallots & Capers
recipe.description: A light, brothy pasta with cherry tomatoes, white fish, and a crispy caper topping. Perfect for a fresh, seaside-inspired meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: colatura di alici or fish sauce (optional)
mezzi paccheri or other tubular pasta
skinless white fish (e.g., Pollock), cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: For the topping, heat ¼ cup of olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallots, cooking until browned, about 5 minutes. Add capers, cook 1 minute, then stir in 1 tbsp parsley and red pepper flakes. Set aside.
In a large sauté pan over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp olive oil. Add tomatoes, salt, and pepper, cooking until softened, 8-10 minutes.
Add tomato paste, cooking 1 minute. Deglaze with wine, if using, and reduce by half, 3-5 minutes. Add 2 cups of water, simmer for 10 minutes, then add fish sauce to taste.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until just shy of al dente.
Season fish with salt and pepper, add to the broth, and cook over low heat for 4 minutes, flipping once.
Add pasta to the pan, stirring to combine with the broth and breaking up the fish into flakes. Simmer for 1-2 minutes.
Serve pasta with caper topping, remaining parsley, and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Pasta with Creamy Cherry Tomato Sauce
recipe.description: A simple, creamy pasta dish featuring charred cherry tomatoes, garlic, and anchovies, finished with fresh herbs. Perfect for a summery weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: short-shaped pasta (such as penne, fusilli, or cavatappi)

steps: Set a large pot of water to boil. Season with salt when it starts to simmer.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add tomatoes, season with salt, and cook for about 5 minutes until tomatoes char and release juices.
Add anchovies, garlic, and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Stir and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in the half-and-half, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Cook pasta until al dente. Drain and add pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat. Adjust salt and red pepper if needed.
Serve hot, topped with fresh herbs.

recipe.name: Korean Rice Cake "Lasagna"
recipe.description: A unique lasagna featuring chewy Korean rice cakes layered with spicy gochujang sauce, creamy béchamel, and savory pork, topped with melted cheese and chili-garlic oil.
steps: Mix ground pork with cornstarch. Heat sesame and olive oil in a pot over medium-high, cook pork until browned. Blend apple, garlic, shallot, soy sauce, fish sauce, black pepper, and Sichuan pepper into a smooth paste. Add to pork and cook until deeply caramelized. Set aside.
Mix gochujang, yogurt, milk, maple syrup, and Dijon mustard until smooth. Set aside.

Blend garlic chives with milk and heavy cream until smooth. In a pot, cook butter and flour over medium heat until foamy. Remove from heat, whisk in chive mixture, return to heat, add fish sauce and nutmeg, and cook until thickened. Set aside.
Combine chile flakes, grated garlic, and sesame oil in a bowl.

Assemble in a baking dish, layering gochujang sauce, rice cakes, pork mixture, green béchamel, and cheese. Repeat until all ingredients are used. Top with cheese and spoon gochugaru oil over. Cover with foil.
Bake at 355°F for 1 hour, then let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Mandilli de Sea With Sugo Finto & Parmesan Crisps
recipe.description: A luxurious pasta dish with delicate handkerchief pasta (mandilli de sea) served with a savory vegetarian 'meat' sauce (sugo finto) and crisp Parmesan.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fennel bulb or large carrot, finely chopped

steps: In a saucepan, melt half the butter over medium heat and add the meat substitute. Cook, stirring, until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
In the same pan, melt remaining butter, add chopped vegetables with a pinch of salt, and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
Add garlic and cook briefly. Stir in tomato and miso pastes, cooking until tomato paste darkens, about 2 minutes. Return meat to pan.
Add red wine and Worcestershire sauce, simmer for 1-2 minutes. Add vegetable stock, cover, and simmer for 1 hour.
Add milk, stir, and continue simmering for 45 minutes. Season to taste.
For the pasta, mix flours and eggs until smooth, knead, then rest for 30 minutes. Roll thin, cut into large squares.
For Parmesan crisps, bake grated cheese in a thin layer at 400°F for 5-7 minutes until golden.
Serve pasta with sauce and Parmesan crisps.

recipe.name: Cold Soba With Perilla Oil Dressing
recipe.description: A quick, refreshing Korean-inspired soba noodle dish with a nutty perilla oil dressing, topped with sesame seeds and seaweed. Perfect for hot days or as a light meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: roasted dried seaweed (Korean gim or Japanese nori)

steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the soba noodles.
In a large bowl, mix perilla oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Set aside.
In a mortar and pestle, coarsely grind the sesame seeds. Crush the seaweed sheet by hand or with a plastic bag and set aside.
Cook soba noodles for exactly 4 minutes. Rinse in cold water several times to remove starch, then drain well.
Add the noodles to the bowl with the dressing and toss to coat.
Plate the noodles, topping with crushed sesame seeds and seaweed. Garnish with cucumber and shredded chicken, if using. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Vegan Pasta al Limone(ish)
recipe.description: A creamy, tangy pasta made with a cashew-based sauce, lemon juice, and nutritional yeast, perfect for a light and flavorful vegan meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: raw cashews, soaked in hot water
flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest

steps: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain.

In a blender, combine soaked cashews, lemon peel and juice, olive oil, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup of reserved pasta water. Blend until smooth, adding more water to achieve desired consistency.
Return pasta to pot, add sauce, and toss to coat. Thin with additional pasta water if needed. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve with flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest on top.

recipe.name: Stovetop Mac & Cheese With Garlic Powder & White Pepper
recipe.description: A quick and creamy stovetop mac and cheese inspired by classic flavors, featuring garlic powder and white pepper for extra depth.

ingredients.ingredient_unit: for pasta water and to taste

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente, checking after 4 minutes. Drain.
Return pot to medium heat, add cream, and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.
Reduce heat to low, add cheese, garlic powder, and white pepper. Whisk until smooth.
Stir pasta into sauce, adjusting seasoning as needed. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Peruvian Chicken & Basil Pasta (Sopa Seca)
recipe.description: A traditional Peruvian one-pot pasta dish with a vibrant basil sauce, spiced chicken, and annatto-infused oil, perfect as a comforting main course.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces

steps: Blend basil leaves with 1 cup of chicken stock until smooth. Set aside.
Season chicken with cumin, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a large pot, fry annatto seeds for about 6 minutes, then remove seeds.
Brown chicken in annatto oil, transfer to a bowl, and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté onion until softened. Add garlic, ají panca paste (if using), carrot, and tomatoes, cooking until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the basil puree, season with salt, and bring to a simmer.
Add spaghetti and remaining chicken stock. Gently stir pasta every 30 seconds until pliable, then mix in chicken.
Cook on medium-low heat until pasta absorbs the liquid and is fully cooked, about 15-20 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Garnish with parsley and optional avocado cubes. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Squash & Brown Butter Tortelli With Brussels Sprouts & Balsamic
recipe.description: A luxurious handmade tortelli pasta filled with creamy squash, served with nutty Brussels sprouts and a tangy balsamic reduction for a perfect autumnal dish.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F and roast the squash with olive oil, salt, and pepper until tender, about 45 minutes.
Make brown butter by cooking butter until golden and nutty. Reserve 50g for the filling.
Reduce balsamic vinegar over medium-low heat until thickened to a syrupy consistency. Set aside.
Prepare the pasta dough by mixing flours and eggs, knead until smooth, and let rest for 30 minutes.
Blend roasted squash with brown butter, cheeses, nutmeg, salt, and pepper until creamy. Refrigerate the filling.
Roll out pasta dough, cut into squares, and fill with squash mixture. Seal and shape tortelli.
Cook Brussels sprouts in butter until golden and slightly crispy. Set aside.
Boil tortelli, toss with reserved brown butter, and plate with Brussels sprouts and balsamic reduction.

recipe.name: Harissa Lamb Orecchiette With Mustard Greens
recipe.description: A flavorful pasta dish combining homemade orecchiette with spiced ground lamb, smoky harissa, bright orange zest, and tender mustard greens, topped with crunchy pistachios.

ingredients.ingredient_name: semolina flour, plus more as needed
tepid water, plus more as needed
small yellow or white onion, minced
harissa paste, plus more as needed

steps: To make the orecchiette, combine AP flour, semolina flour, and 1 tsp salt in a bowl. Stir in tepid water to form a dough and knead for 10 minutes. Let rest for at least 1 hour.
Roll the dough into logs, cut into pieces, and shape into orecchiette using your thumb. Cook in boiling salted water until al dente, about 3 minutes.

For the lamb, heat grapeseed oil in a sauté pan. Cook lamb, onion, and 1 tsp salt until browned and softened, about 4 minutes. Add cumin, minced garlic, harissa, orange zest, and tomato paste. Simmer for 3 minutes.
In another pan, heat olive oil. Add mustard greens and sauté until wilted, about 3 minutes. Add sliced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Toss the orecchiette with lamb, greens, pistachios, and red pepper flakes. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Mee Goreng Mamak (Mamak-Style Stir-Fried Noodles)
recipe.description: A flavorful and nostalgic Malaysian noodle dish combining fresh yellow noodles with a savory-sweet sauce, potatoes, tofu, and choy sum, perfect for a quick dinner.
steps: Wash and boil the potato until fork-tender, about 30 minutes. Peel and cut into cubes.
Mix all sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside.
Rinse fresh yellow noodles in cold water to loosen and remove excess oil, or blanch briefly in hot water.
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a wok. Sauté garlic until aromatic. Add choy sum and noodles, tossing to combine.
Push ingredients to the side, add more oil if needed, and pour in the plant-based 'egg'. Let it set before mixing with the noodles.
Add cooked potato cubes, tofu slices, and the prepared sauce. Toss gently to combine, taking care not to break the noodles.
Fold in mung bean sprouts and cook for another minute. Adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve topped with shredded green lettuce, chili slices, fried shallots, and lime wedges.

recipe.name: Vicky Bennison's 'Cupboard Is Bare' Pasta & Chickpeas
recipe.description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish made with pantry staples like canned chickpeas, garlic, and rosemary, finished with Parmigiano for a quick and delicious meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: good-quality pasta (e.g., fusilli lungi, penne, or orecchiette)

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, heat a generous drizzle of olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook gently until softened but not browned.
Add the drained chickpeas to the pan and stir well. Use the back of a spoon to crush about half of the chickpeas for a creamier texture.
Stir in the minced rosemary and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Add a ladleful of the starchy pasta cooking water and let it simmer for about a minute.
Drain the pasta and toss it in the pan with the chickpea mixture. Mix well to coat the pasta.
Serve immediately, topped with grated Parmigiano.

recipe.name: Sweet Potato Breakfast Gnocchi
recipe.description: Delicate gnocchi made from sweet potatoes and ricotta, served with a maple-butter sauce infused with orange and cinnamon, topped with toasted pecans.

ingredients.ingredient_name: All-purpose flour, plus more for dusting

steps: Heat your oven to 400°F. Wash your sweet potatoes and score them with an 'X'. Place them on a baking sheet and bake until very soft, close to an hour. Allow to cool, remove the peels, and press the potatoes through a potato ricer. Measure out one cup of the mashed sweet potato.

In a mixing bowl, stir together the sweet potato mash, ricotta, salt, and egg until combined. Then, stir in the flour 1/4 cup at a time, just until you have a workable dough. It will be sticky; use as little flour as possible to keep the gnocchi light.
Turn the dough out onto a well-floured surface and keep your hands floured as well. Divide it into four pieces and roll each piece into a log about an inch thick.

Using a sharp knife, cut the logs into 1-inch pieces. Optionally, use the back of a fork to press tine marks into your gnocchi. If not cooking immediately, refrigerate them or freeze them on a baking sheet, then store in the freezer. Do not defrost frozen gnocchi; cook them directly from frozen.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Gently add about half of your gnocchi. Boil until they rise to the surface, then scoop them out with a slotted spoon and place in a bowl. Repeat with the remaining gnocchi.

For the maple-butter sauce: In a frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the orange zest, maple syrup, orange juice, rum (if using), and cinnamon. Stir to combine and let it cook for a couple of minutes until it thickens slightly.
Add the cooked gnocchi to the sauce, stirring to coat them well. Cook them on medium for a minute or two on each side, until they look a little golden.
Divide the gnocchi between four bowls and sprinkle each with the toasted pecans. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Lemony Pasta With Sardines & Escarole
recipe.description: A quick and zesty pasta dish combining tinned sardines, escarole, lemon, and chile flakes for a light and flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: tinned sardines packed in olive oil
mild chile flakes (Aleppo, Espelette, or gochugaru)
head of escarole or romaine, roughly torn
chopped fresh dill, mint, or basil

steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
While the pasta cooks, drain the oil from the sardine tins into a large bowl. Grate garlic and lemon zest into the bowl, and stir in chile flakes.
Add the cooked pasta to the bowl and toss aggressively to coat in the garlicky oil.
Halve the lemon and squeeze its juice into the bowl. Add torn escarole and chopped herbs, then gently toss to combine.
Add the sardines, breaking them into smaller pieces if desired. Adjust seasoning with salt and chile flakes to taste.
Drizzle with extra olive oil before serving, if desired.

recipe.name: Saffron Pasta With White Wine & Cream
recipe.description: A luxurious and quick pasta dish featuring saffron-infused sauce with white wine and cream, perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes (optional)

steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt it generously.
Crush saffron threads gently and steep in hot water for 10–15 minutes.
In a sauté pan, simmer white wine over medium heat until reduced by half, about 3–5 minutes.
Lower the heat to medium-low, then whisk in 2 tablespoons of butter one at a time until emulsified.
Stir in the cream, saffron liquid, and a pinch of salt. Simmer for 2 minutes until slightly thickened. Remove from heat.
Cook pasta according to package instructions or until al dente. If using fresh pasta, cook for 2–3 minutes.
Reheat the sauce and transfer pasta to the pan using tongs. Add the remaining butter and toss to coat. Adjust the consistency with pasta cooking water if needed.
Serve immediately, garnished with Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes if desired.

recipe.name: Summery Fresh Tomato & Pistachio Pasta
recipe.description: A refreshing pasta dish featuring fresh tomatoes, toasted pistachios, and a garlic-anchovy paste, served at room temperature for a perfect summer meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: very ripe roma tomatoes, cored and chopped

steps: Toss tomatoes with 2 teaspoons of sea salt in a large bowl and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to macerate.
On a cutting board, smash garlic, anchovies, and a pinch of salt into a smooth paste.
Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside in a large serving bowl.

Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely ground. Add macerated tomatoes with their juices, garlic-anchovy paste, and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano. Pulse until the sauce is smooth but slightly textured.
Mix the tomato mixture with olive oil and toss with the pasta until coated.
Serve pasta at room temperature garnished with basil leaves, cracked black pepper, and extra Parmigiano-Reggiano or olive oil if desired.

recipe.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken Pasta
recipe.description: A comforting dish combining creamy Alfredo sauce, fresh basil pesto, and crispy seared chicken, tossed with pasta for a flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
grated Parmesan, plus extra for serving

steps: Cook pasta in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of cooking water.
To make the pesto, blend basil, pine nuts, Parmesan, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending until combined but slightly textured.
Heat olive oil and half the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, season with salt and pepper, and cook for about 5 minutes until browned. Remove from skillet.

Add remaining butter to the skillet. Sauté garlic for 2 minutes. Pour in cream, bring to a boil, and stir to dissolve browned bits. Add pesto, cooked chicken, and Parmesan. Stir until cheese is melted. Add reserved pasta water if needed to thin the sauce.
Toss in pasta until evenly coated. Serve with grated Parmesan and toasted pine nuts if desired.

recipe.name: Double Chocolate Espresso Cookies
recipe.description: Rich and decadent chocolate cookies with a kick of espresso, perfect for grown-ups and special occasions. Crisp on the edges and chewy in the middle, these cookies are best enjoyed with a glass of milk.
steps: Preheat oven to 350° F.
Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Then, add eggs one at a time, mixing after each addition.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder.
With the mixer on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Drop dough by rounded teaspoon onto the sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

recipe.name: Nik Sharma's Spicy Chocolate Chip–Hazelnut Cookies
recipe.description: A one-bowl, crisp-chewy cookie that is gluten-free, with hazelnut flour, jaggery, bittersweet chocolate, and a kick of black pepper. Inspired by Nutella, this cookie balances spicy, nutty, and chocolate flavors.
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the hazelnut meal, jaggery, baking powder, baking soda, black pepper, and salt.
Add the egg, melted butter, hazelnut extract, chocolate, and ginger, and stir with a large wooden spoon until the dough comes together.
Grease your hands with a little oil to prevent the dough from sticking. Divide the dough into twelve equal parts and shape them into balls. Flatten them into 2-inch (5 cm) rounds.
Place the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Wrap the entire baking sheet tightly in plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 10 minutes, preferably 2 hours.
To bake, preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a second baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove the baking sheet from the freezer and put half the rounds of dough on the second sheet. Spread out the rounds on both baking sheets and refrigerate one of them.
Bake one batch of cookies at a time until golden brown, about 12 to 15 minutes. Cool completely on wire racks.

recipe.name: Brown Butter Bourbon Banana Bread
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful banana bread enhanced with nutty brown butter and a splash of bourbon, offering a delightful twist on a classic favorite.
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease only the bottom of a standard size loaf pan with butter or nonstick cooking spray.
Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a medium-sized bowl. Set aside.
Melt butter over medium heat in a small, heavy-bottomed pot. Cook until it begins to brown, but not burn; it will smell nutty and fragrant. Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes.
Peel and dice one banana. Mash the remaining two bananas in a small bowl; set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the brown sugar in a small skillet over medium heat until it begins to melt and turn golden. Add diced banana pieces and sauté until well coated and caramelized. Remove from the pan and set aside.

Beat eggs on medium speed in a stand mixer. Add the remaining brown sugar and beat until foamy and combined. Add the mashed bananas, cooled browned butter, vanilla, and bourbon; beat until mixed well. Scrape down sides of bowl again with rubber spatula.

On low speed, pour in one-third of the flour mixture. Increase mixer speed to medium and mix until just blended. Pour in one-third of buttermilk and beat until just blended. Repeat this process with remaining flour and buttermilk.
Fold in pecans and caramelized banana pieces. Pour into prepared loaf pan and bake for 55 to 60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

recipe.name: Cinnamon Sugar Breakfast Puffs
recipe.description: A delightful hybrid of spice cake, muffins, and cinnamon sugar donut holes, offering a cakey and light texture with crisp edges and a crunchy cinnamon sugar coating.
steps: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the 1/3 cup butter over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until browned and nutty smelling. Pour into a mixing bowl and allow to cool completely to room temperature.
Preheat your oven to 350°F. Grease and lightly flour a 12-cup muffin tin.
Add the sugar and egg to the cooled butter. Beat with an electric mixer until all creamed together, lightened in color, and fluffy (about 5 minutes).
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, spices, and orange zest.
Add the dry ingredients in increments to the butter-sugar mixture, alternating with the milk and beating until fully combined after each addition.
Divide the batter evenly into the cups of the muffin tin. Bake until golden brown and fragrant, about 20-25 minutes.
While the puffs are baking, put the melted butter in one shallow bowl and combine the sugar and cinnamon in another.

When the puffs come out of the oven, use a knife to gently pop them all out of the muffin tin. One by one, dip each puff in the melted butter—get it all over it—then roll it in the cinnamon sugar. Transfer to a serving platter and continue until all puffs are coated. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Creamy Coconut Milk Millet Pudding
recipe.description: A rich and creamy pudding made with lightly toasted millet and coconut milk, scented with vanilla, cinnamon, and almond extract. Perfect for breakfast or dessert.
steps: Lightly toast the millet in a dry saucepan over medium heat until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the coconut milk, water, vanilla extract, and cinnamon stick to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 25 minutes, or until the millet is tender and the mixture is creamy.
Remove the cinnamon stick and stir in the maple syrup. Adjust seasoning with salt, if needed.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with toasted coconut flakes.

recipe.name: Coconut Rice Pudding with Raspberries
recipe.description: A comforting dessert or filling breakfast featuring risotto rice slowly cooked in coconut milk, paired with tangy raspberries and crunchy pistachio nut brittle.
steps: Start by making the pistachio brittle. Put the sugar with 4 teaspoons of water into a small frying pan and leave to melt, stirring from time to time. Once the sugar syrup starts bubbling, stop stirring and leave to bubble until the caramel starts turning light golden. Add the pistachios and stir to coat them. Pour the pistachio brittle onto a piece of baking paper and leave to cool.
Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the rice. Stir for one minute until translucent.

Add a ladle of the coconut milk and the sugar, and bring to the boil while stirring. Once the risotto rice has absorbed most of the coconut milk, gradually add the rest of the coconut milk—a ladle at a time, stirring between each addition and only adding more coconut milk once all the liquid has been absorbed.
Repeat this process with the milk. In total, this will take approximately 20 minutes.
Break up the cooled pistachio brittle. Divide the rice pudding between four bowls, top with raspberries and pistachio brittle.

recipe.name: Brown Butter Waffle Cake + Sorghum Meringue Buttercream
recipe.description: A unique cake composed of rich brown butter waffles layered with a sweet and slightly tangy sorghum meringue buttercream, perfect for breakfast lovers celebrating special occasions.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Brown butter, cooled to room temperature
Unsalted butter, room temperature, cut into tablespoon-size pieces

steps: For the waffle cake: Whisk all dry ingredients together in a large mixing bowl to combine well.
Whisk all wet ingredients together to combine in a separate bowl.
Stir wet ingredients into dry gently to just combine, being careful to not over-mix—this will make the waffles tough.
Oil and heat your waffle iron and let the batter sit while you make your buttercream.

When waffle iron is hot, pour two small ladles of batter onto the griddle, close, and cook for 4 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Repeat with remaining batter. Cool waffles completely before assembling the cake.
Once waffles are cooled, stack two of them to form the first layer of the cake, slather with the buttercream, top with two more waffles and then another layer of buttercream. Finish with fresh fruit.
For the sorghum meringue buttercream: Mix egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment on medium speed until they hold soft peaks.
Add in the sugar one teaspoon at a time, continuing to beat, until they just hold stiff peaks.
Boil the sorghum syrup without stirring in a small saucepan with a candy thermometer attached until it reaches 238°F to 242°F.

Immediately remove from heat and stream down side of bowl into egg whites, beating constantly on high. Beat until meringue is completely cool, 10 minutes or more depending on how warm your kitchen is, and then gradually whip in the sorghum.
Add the butter one tablespoon at a time, beating well between additions. If mixture looks curdled, just keep beating—it'll come together.
Buttercream can be made up to one week ahead, chilled and covered. To revive, just bring to room temp and whip back to life with your mixer.

recipe.name: Sweet Omelet with Berries
recipe.description: A delightful sweet omelet filled with a warm berry compote, offering a unique twist on a classic breakfast dish.
steps: In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and heavy cream together until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and melt the butter.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook gently, without stirring, until the edges start to set.
While the omelet cooks, heat the berries in a small saucepan over medium heat until they soften. Stir in the honey.
Carefully fold the omelet in half or thirds, then slide onto a plate.
Top with the warm berry compote and garnish with powdered sugar if desired.

recipe.name: Autumn Breakfast (or Anytime) Buckle
recipe.description: A warm, spiced buckle combining apples, pears, and cranberries, topped with a buttery crumble, perfect for breakfast or dessert.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, mix the melted butter, buttermilk, and egg. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fold in the diced apples, pears, and cranberries.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and spread evenly.
Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over the top of the batter.
Bake for 40–45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Sweet Vegan Chickpea Crêpes
recipe.description: Delicate and slightly sweet crêpes made with chickpea flour, offering a nutty flavor and a perfect base for your favorite sweet toppings.
steps: In a mixing bowl, whisk together chickpea flour, water, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt until smooth and lump-free.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with oil.
Pour a small amount of batter (about 1/4 cup) into the skillet and swirl to spread it evenly.
Cook until the edges begin to lift and the bottom is golden, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook for another minute.
Repeat with the remaining batter, greasing the skillet as needed.
Serve the crêpes warm with your favorite sweet toppings.

recipe.name: Raspberry-Rhubarb Crumble with Cracklin' Oat Bran Topping
recipe.description: A delightful crumble combining tart rhubarb and sweet raspberries, topped with a crunchy Cracklin' Oat Bran and nut mixture.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a mixing bowl, combine the rhubarb, raspberries, sugar, flour, and salt. Toss to coat evenly.
Transfer the fruit mixture to a greased baking dish.
In another bowl, mix the Cracklin' Oat Bran cereal, pecans, and melted butter until combined.
Sprinkle the topping evenly over the fruit mixture.
Bake for 35–40 minutes, or until the fruit is bubbly and the topping is golden brown.
Let cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Pecorino Romano Cake with Candied Tomatoes
recipe.description: A unique cake combining the savory notes of Pecorino Romano cheese with the sweetness of candied tomatoes, offering a delightful balance of flavors.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the cherry tomatoes with 2 tablespoons of sugar until caramelized. Set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and black pepper.
In another bowl, beat the eggs with the milk and olive oil. Stir in the grated Pecorino Romano cheese.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
Top the batter with the caramelized cherry tomatoes, arranging them evenly.
Bake for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

recipe.name: Spaghetti with Fried Eggs and Pangrattato for One
recipe.description: A simple yet luxurious dish of spaghetti topped with runny fried eggs, garlic, capers, and crunchy pangrattato (breadcrumbs). Perfect for a solo dinner that's both comforting and quick.
steps: Cook spaghetti in a pot of salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving some of the cooking liquid.
In a pan, heat olive oil and butter. Add garlic and fry the eggs, ensuring the whites set while the yolks remain runny.
Toss the cooked pasta with the fried eggs, parsley, capers, and garlic. Add some of the reserved cooking water for a creamier consistency if needed.
Serve the pasta with grated Pecorino Romano and top with crunchy pangrattato.

recipe.name: Classic Chicken Piccata
recipe.description: A classic Italian-American dish featuring tender chicken breast cutlets cooked in a zesty lemon-butter caper sauce. This light and flavorful dish is perfect for a quick weeknight meal or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Boneless, skinless chicken breasts, trimmed and pounded until 1/4 inch thick
Couscous or angel hair pasta (for serving)

steps: Cut one lemon in half lengthwise. Trim the ends from one half and cut across into thin slices about 1/8 inch thick; set aside. Juice the remaining half and whole lemon to obtain about 1/4 cup juice; set aside.
Season both sides of the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper. Place flour into a shallow dish or pan. Coat each breast with flour, and shake to remove excess.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat until hot, about 2 minutes. Cook half the batch in the skillet without moving them until lightly browned on the first side, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Turn and cook until the second side is lightly browned, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes longer. Transfer to a plate kept warm in the oven, or cover with aluminum foil. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the skillet and heat until shimmering. Add remaining chicken pieces and repeat. Add cooked chicken to previous batch and keep warm in 200-degree oven.

Using the pan in which you cooked the chicken, sauté the shallots in the oil and browned bits remaining in the pan. Once shallots become translucent, add the chicken broth and lemon slices. Allow to cook until lemon slices are well-softened.

Add the capers and lemon juice, and allow to reduce to concentrate flavors. Remove pan from heat and swirl in the butter until it melts and thickens the sauce. Swirl in the parsley. Spoon over chicken and serve immediately over a bed of couscous or angel hair pasta.

recipe.name: Chickpea, Pumpkin, and Sage Stew
recipe.description: A hearty and comforting one-dish meal featuring chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and fresh sage. This cozy autumnal stew is easy to prepare with pantry staples and is perfect for chilly evenings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Ditalini, tubetti, or other small pasta like orzo

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped carrot, onion, and sage leaves. Sauté until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and chicken broth. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Add the pasta and cook until tender, about 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Farro with Fennel, Tomatoes & Parmesan
recipe.description: A savory and aromatic dish that combines nutty farro with sweet fennel, cherry tomatoes, and a touch of anchovy. Finished with a bright fennel frond pesto and Parmesan, it’s a simple, flavorful one-pan meal.
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the anchovy and stir until it dissolves into the oil. Add the farro and fry for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.

Add the stock, lemon zest, fennel, garlic, cherry tomatoes, salt, and chile flakes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 25 minutes until the farro is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
While the farro is cooking, make the fennel frond pesto: chop fennel fronds with pine nuts and Parmesan, then mix with olive oil and lemon juice.
Once the farro is done, spoon the fennel frond pesto over the top while still in the skillet. Garnish with more Parmesan and serve warm.

recipe.name: Creamy Tortellini Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A rich and comforting soup with cheese tortellini, Italian sausage, bell pepper, and a creamy tomato broth. Perfect for a cozy meal.
steps: Heat oil and butter in a pot over medium heat. Add bell pepper, sauté for 5 minutes.
Add shallots and garlic, cook for 2 minutes.
Add sausage, oregano, sage, paprika, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Break up the meat and cook until browned, 5 minutes.
Add chicken broth, tomato paste, and puréed tomatoes. Cook for 15 minutes.
Add tortellini, cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cream and Parmesan. Simmer for 1 minute, adjust seasoning, and serve with thyme.

recipe.name: Chicken Florentine by Joanna Gaines
recipe.description: A classic one-skillet Chicken Florentine with creamy sauce, spinach, and a hint of lemon.
steps: Heat olive oil in skillet, season chicken with pepper and 2 tsp salt, dredge in flour.
Cook chicken until golden, about 8 mins per side, then set aside.
Reduce heat, melt butter, add shallots and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add wine, simmer to reduce by half, then add cream, cooking until thickened.
Stir in spinach and remaining salt until wilted.
Slice chicken, return to skillet, garnish with parsley and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Pizza Party Strata
recipe.description: A savory, pizza-inspired strata with garlic bread, pepperoni, mozzarella, and marinara. Ideal for breakfast or brunch.
steps: Heat the oven to 350°F and grease a high-sided 10-inch skillet or 9x9-inch baking dish with olive oil.
Spread cubed garlic bread on a sheet pan and toast until lightly browned, about 10-12 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs until smooth. Add milk, salt, red pepper flakes, and oregano, whisking to combine.
Add pepperoni and all but a handful of mozzarella, mixing with a spatula to combine.
Fold in toasted bread cubes until moistened, then transfer to the prepared pan. Dollop marinara on top and sprinkle remaining mozzarella.
Chill for up to 24 hours or bake immediately. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes until puffed and golden.
Garnish with Parmesan, basil, and serve with additional marinara if desired.

recipe.name: Risotto alla Carbonara
recipe.description: A creamy, indulgent risotto inspired by classic pasta carbonara, featuring guanciale, egg yolk, and Pecorino Romano.
steps: Starting from a cold pan, heat the guanciale in olive oil until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté shallots, then add rice and toast for 1 minute. Add vermouth and reduce completely.
Slowly add hot chicken broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring until absorbed, about 16 minutes. Check if rice is al dente.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg yolk, cream, pepper, and cheese.
Fold the egg mixture into the risotto, mixing until creamy. Top with guanciale, Pecorino shavings, and black pepper.

recipe.name: Slow Cooker Pasta e Fagioli
recipe.description: A comforting Italian-style soup with beans, pasta, and tomatoes, simmered in a slow cooker for a rich, savory flavor.
steps: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil and sauté onion, carrot, and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add thyme, rosemary, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper, and cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a slow cooker. Add tomatoes (broken into pieces), beans, stock, bay leaf, and Parmesan rind. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours or on low for 5 hours.

If serving immediately, add pasta directly to the slow cooker and cook for 15 minutes. Alternatively, cook pasta separately and add to each bowl before serving to prevent it from absorbing too much broth.
Serve with chopped parsley and grated Parmesan, with crusty bread on the side if desired.

recipe.name: Giambotta (Italian Summer Vegetable Stew)
recipe.description: A traditional Italian vegetable stew made with summer produce like potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes. Perfect for using up fresh garden vegetables.

ingredients.ingredient_name: white or yellow onion, finely chopped

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, and cook until browned.
Add potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, green beans, and bell pepper. Stir to coat with oil.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and broth, stir, and cover. Simmer for about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.
Add cherry tomatoes and basil. Stir and cook uncovered for 2-3 minutes to let the tomatoes soften.
Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve hot or cold with grated cheese and day-old bread, if desired.

recipe.name: Porcini Mushroom Risotto
recipe.description: A creamy, savory risotto featuring fresh porcini mushrooms, Parmesan, and a touch of white wine. Perfect for cozy fall dinners.
steps: In a medium skillet over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp of olive oil with garlic. Once garlic is golden, add mushrooms and cook until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add salt midway through. Discard garlic, set mushrooms aside.
In a pan, heat remaining olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, cooking until softened, about 10 minutes without browning.
Add rice, stirring to coat, then cook until rice is translucent, about 2 minutes. Add wine, stirring until evaporated.
Add 1 cup of broth, stirring until absorbed. Repeat with another cup, then 1/2 cup, cooking until rice is nearly al dente.
Stir in mushrooms, cooking until rice is fully cooked but retains some bite, about 3-5 minutes. Add extra broth if needed.
Remove from heat, stir in Parmesan and butter. Season to taste and garnish with parsley if desired.

recipe.name: Asparagus & Crispy Cannellini Beans with Mint & Grana Padano
recipe.description: A refreshing spring salad with crispy roasted cannellini beans, blanched asparagus, fresh mint, and shavings of Grana Padano or Parmigiano-Reggiano.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F. Pat beans dry, then spread on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 3 tbsp olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and roast for 20 minutes or until crisp.
Blanch asparagus in salted boiling water for 1 minute, then transfer to an ice bath. Slice into 2-inch pieces.
