In a large bowl, combine arugula, asparagus, cheese, mint, and beans. Drizzle with remaining olive oil and toss gently.
Serve on a platter, scatter anchovies if using, and sprinkle with flaky sea salt.

recipe.name: Brothy Tomato Pasta with White Fish, Shallots & Capers
recipe.description: A light, brothy pasta with cherry tomatoes, white fish, and a crispy caper topping. Perfect for a fresh, seaside-inspired meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: colatura di alici or fish sauce (optional)
mezzi paccheri or other tubular pasta
skinless white fish (e.g., Pollock), cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: For the topping, heat ¼ cup of olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallots, cooking until browned, about 5 minutes. Add capers, cook 1 minute, then stir in 1 tbsp parsley and red pepper flakes. Set aside.
In a large sauté pan over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp olive oil. Add tomatoes, salt, and pepper, cooking until softened, 8-10 minutes.
Add tomato paste, cooking 1 minute. Deglaze with wine, if using, and reduce by half, 3-5 minutes. Add 2 cups of water, simmer for 10 minutes, then add fish sauce to taste.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until just shy of al dente.
Season fish with salt and pepper, add to the broth, and cook over low heat for 4 minutes, flipping once.
Add pasta to the pan, stirring to combine with the broth and breaking up the fish into flakes. Simmer for 1-2 minutes.
Serve pasta with caper topping, remaining parsley, and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Pasta with Creamy Cherry Tomato Sauce
recipe.description: A simple, creamy pasta dish featuring charred cherry tomatoes, garlic, and anchovies, finished with fresh herbs. Perfect for a summery weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: short-shaped pasta (such as penne, fusilli, or cavatappi)

steps: Set a large pot of water to boil. Season with salt when it starts to simmer.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add tomatoes, season with salt, and cook for about 5 minutes until tomatoes char and release juices.
Add anchovies, garlic, and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Stir and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in the half-and-half, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Cook pasta until al dente. Drain and add pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat. Adjust salt and red pepper if needed.
Serve hot, topped with fresh herbs.

recipe.name: Italian-Style Meatballs With Impossible™ Burger
recipe.description: Juicy, flavorful plant-based meatballs made with Impossible™ Burger, Parmesan, fennel, and Calabrian chile paste. Perfect for serving with marinara sauce or in a sandwich.
steps: In a large bowl, combine the panko and milk, letting it sit for 5 minutes to absorb. Add Parmesan, egg, garlic, parsley, salt, chile paste, and fennel. Mix well.
Add the Impossible Burger, mixing until fully combined. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Drizzle a sheet pan with 1 tbsp olive oil. With oiled hands, divide the mixture into 14 portions and roll each into a ball.
Heat remaining olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook meatballs for 1-1.5 minutes per side until browned.
Serve hot or add to marinara sauce and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with pasta or in a sandwich.

recipe.name: Mandilli de Sea With Sugo Finto & Parmesan Crisps
recipe.description: A luxurious pasta dish with delicate handkerchief pasta (mandilli de sea) served with a savory vegetarian 'meat' sauce (sugo finto) and crisp Parmesan.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fennel bulb or large carrot, finely chopped

steps: In a saucepan, melt half the butter over medium heat and add the meat substitute. Cook, stirring, until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
In the same pan, melt remaining butter, add chopped vegetables with a pinch of salt, and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
Add garlic and cook briefly. Stir in tomato and miso pastes, cooking until tomato paste darkens, about 2 minutes. Return meat to pan.
Add red wine and Worcestershire sauce, simmer for 1-2 minutes. Add vegetable stock, cover, and simmer for 1 hour.
Add milk, stir, and continue simmering for 45 minutes. Season to taste.
For the pasta, mix flours and eggs until smooth, knead, then rest for 30 minutes. Roll thin, cut into large squares.
For Parmesan crisps, bake grated cheese in a thin layer at 400°F for 5-7 minutes until golden.
Serve pasta with sauce and Parmesan crisps.

recipe.name: Vegan Pasta al Limone(ish)
recipe.description: A creamy, tangy pasta made with a cashew-based sauce, lemon juice, and nutritional yeast, perfect for a light and flavorful vegan meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: raw cashews, soaked in hot water
flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest

steps: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain.

In a blender, combine soaked cashews, lemon peel and juice, olive oil, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup of reserved pasta water. Blend until smooth, adding more water to achieve desired consistency.
Return pasta to pot, add sauce, and toss to coat. Thin with additional pasta water if needed. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve with flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest on top.

recipe.name: Garlic-Studded Pork Shoulder With Anchovies & Calabrian Chiles
recipe.description: A savory braised pork shoulder infused with garlic, anchovies, and Calabrian chiles, served with crunchy gremolata bread crumbs.
steps: With a paring knife, poke 20 deep holes in the pork. Place a garlic half in each hole and sprinkle evenly with salt.
In a Dutch oven, heat 3 tbsp oil over medium-high heat. Sear the pork until all sides are golden brown, about 6-8 minutes per side. Remove from pot.
Add remaining oil and sliced onion to the pot, stirring to loosen browned bits. Cook until the onions are light brown and wilted, about 5 minutes.
Add chiles, anchovies, and garlic, cooking until anchovies dissolve. Add white wine and parsley, simmer until mostly reduced, about 8-10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Add 2 cups water, black pepper, and fennel seeds to the pot. Return pork to the pot, skin side up if applicable. Cover and braise in the oven for 3-4 hours.
For the gremolata bread crumbs: In a skillet, cook panko with olive oil until golden brown. Add parsley, lemon zest, garlic, and salt, stirring until combined. Set aside.
Serve pork with gremolata bread crumbs, fresh parsley, and your choice of sides.

recipe.name: Squash & Brown Butter Tortelli With Brussels Sprouts & Balsamic
recipe.description: A luxurious handmade tortelli pasta filled with creamy squash, served with nutty Brussels sprouts and a tangy balsamic reduction for a perfect autumnal dish.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F and roast the squash with olive oil, salt, and pepper until tender, about 45 minutes.
Make brown butter by cooking butter until golden and nutty. Reserve 50g for the filling.
Reduce balsamic vinegar over medium-low heat until thickened to a syrupy consistency. Set aside.
Prepare the pasta dough by mixing flours and eggs, knead until smooth, and let rest for 30 minutes.
Blend roasted squash with brown butter, cheeses, nutmeg, salt, and pepper until creamy. Refrigerate the filling.
Roll out pasta dough, cut into squares, and fill with squash mixture. Seal and shape tortelli.
Cook Brussels sprouts in butter until golden and slightly crispy. Set aside.
Boil tortelli, toss with reserved brown butter, and plate with Brussels sprouts and balsamic reduction.

recipe.name: No-Noodle Eggplant Lasagna with Mushroom Ragú
recipe.description: A rich and creamy lasagna featuring roasted eggplant layers, hearty mushroom ragú, and béchamel sauce. A satisfying gluten-free and meatless main dish.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fresh mushrooms, finely chopped (shiitake and cremini preferred)

steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Slice eggplants lengthwise into ½-inch slices. Sprinkle with kosher salt and let sit for 30 minutes. Pat dry with paper towels.
Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and arrange on baking sheets. Roast for 25-30 minutes until lightly browned and tender. Set aside.
In a large pot, heat ¼ cup olive oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and carrot, cooking until softened, about 8 minutes.
Stir in garlic and tomato paste, cooking for 2 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, water, thyme, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 30-40 minutes until thickened.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in milk, stirring constantly, until thickened. Season with salt and nutmeg.
Spread a thin layer of mushroom ragú in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer roasted eggplant slices, béchamel, and ragú. Repeat layers, finishing with béchamel and shredded mozzarella.
Bake at 375°F for 40-45 minutes, until bubbling and golden. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Beetroot Risotto With Goat Cheese
recipe.description: A luxurious and vibrant risotto featuring earthy roasted beets, creamy goat cheese, and a splash of rosé wine for a hint of brightness.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Toss the chopped beets with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast on a sheet pan until tender, about 25–30 minutes. Let cool slightly.
In a small saucepan, bring the stock to a simmer and keep warm over low heat.
In a large, wide-bottomed pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced shallots and sauté until translucent, about 2 minutes.
Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat the grains in butter. Pour in the rosé wine, stirring constantly until it reduces and the alcohol evaporates.

Lower the heat and ladle in the warm stock, one or two ladlefuls at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue until the rice is al dente, about 18–20 minutes.
Meanwhile, puree the roasted beets with sour cream in a blender until smooth.
When the risotto is cooked to your liking, stir in the beet-sour cream puree. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chunks of goat cheese and chopped chives.

recipe.name: Slow-Cooked Tuscan Kale with Pancetta, Bread Crumbs, and a Poached Egg
recipe.description: A hearty and flavorful dish featuring slow-cooked Tuscan kale enriched with crispy pancetta and toasted bread crumbs, topped with a perfectly poached egg.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Tuscan kale, ribs removed, leaves roughly chopped

steps: In a large sauté pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and the minced garlic. Sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the chopped kale and chicken stock. Cover the pan and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, until the kale is tender, about 20 minutes.
Season the kale with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the crispy pancetta.
Divide the kale mixture among serving plates. Top each plate with a poached egg and sprinkle with toasted bread crumbs. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Vicky Bennison's 'Cupboard Is Bare' Pasta & Chickpeas
recipe.description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish made with pantry staples like canned chickpeas, garlic, and rosemary, finished with Parmigiano for a quick and delicious meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: good-quality pasta (e.g., fusilli lungi, penne, or orecchiette)

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, heat a generous drizzle of olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook gently until softened but not browned.
Add the drained chickpeas to the pan and stir well. Use the back of a spoon to crush about half of the chickpeas for a creamier texture.
Stir in the minced rosemary and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Add a ladleful of the starchy pasta cooking water and let it simmer for about a minute.
Drain the pasta and toss it in the pan with the chickpea mixture. Mix well to coat the pasta.
Serve immediately, topped with grated Parmigiano.

recipe.name: Pork Piccata
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful twist on classic piccata, featuring thinly pounded pork loin slices sautéed to perfection, topped with a tangy lemon-caper sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Smithfield Roasted Garlic and Herb Marinated Fresh Pork Loin Filet

steps: Slice the pork loin into 1/4-inch slices and lightly pound them until thin. Season both sides with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour, shaking off excess.
Heat 4 tablespoons of butter and the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium-high heat. Sauté pork slices for 3 minutes per side until nicely browned.
Remove pork from the pan. Deglaze the pan with lemon juice, chicken stock, and capers, scraping the bottom with a wooden spoon. Cook until the liquid reduces by about 1/3.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper, then stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to slightly thicken.
Plate the pork and spoon the lemon-caper sauce over it. Garnish with parsley and serve.

recipe.name: Balsamic Fried Eggs
recipe.description: A simple yet flavorful dish where eggs are fried in olive oil and finished with a drizzle of reduced balsamic vinegar, served atop toasted bread and garnished with arugula.
steps: Add olive oil to an 8-inch skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot but not at the smoking point, crack open the eggs, one at a time, letting each egg set. Cook for about 25 seconds, keeping the heat at medium. As the eggs puff up, season with salt and pepper. Tilt the pan and baste the top of the yolks with the oil to help them cook. Cook to desired doneness.
Place a piece of toast on each plate, top with an egg.

Pour off and discard any excess oil and remove any oily residue from the pan. Put the pan back over medium heat. Add the balsamic vinegar and let it sizzle and reduce slightly for a moment or two. Drizzle over the eggs.
Garnish with arugula and serve.

recipe.name: Sweet Potato Breakfast Gnocchi
recipe.description: Delicate gnocchi made from sweet potatoes and ricotta, served with a maple-butter sauce infused with orange and cinnamon, topped with toasted pecans.

ingredients.ingredient_name: All-purpose flour, plus more for dusting

steps: Heat your oven to 400°F. Wash your sweet potatoes and score them with an 'X'. Place them on a baking sheet and bake until very soft, close to an hour. Allow to cool, remove the peels, and press the potatoes through a potato ricer. Measure out one cup of the mashed sweet potato.

In a mixing bowl, stir together the sweet potato mash, ricotta, salt, and egg until combined. Then, stir in the flour 1/4 cup at a time, just until you have a workable dough. It will be sticky; use as little flour as possible to keep the gnocchi light.
Turn the dough out onto a well-floured surface and keep your hands floured as well. Divide it into four pieces and roll each piece into a log about an inch thick.

Using a sharp knife, cut the logs into 1-inch pieces. Optionally, use the back of a fork to press tine marks into your gnocchi. If not cooking immediately, refrigerate them or freeze them on a baking sheet, then store in the freezer. Do not defrost frozen gnocchi; cook them directly from frozen.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Gently add about half of your gnocchi. Boil until they rise to the surface, then scoop them out with a slotted spoon and place in a bowl. Repeat with the remaining gnocchi.

For the maple-butter sauce: In a frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the orange zest, maple syrup, orange juice, rum (if using), and cinnamon. Stir to combine and let it cook for a couple of minutes until it thickens slightly.
Add the cooked gnocchi to the sauce, stirring to coat them well. Cook them on medium for a minute or two on each side, until they look a little golden.
Divide the gnocchi between four bowls and sprinkle each with the toasted pecans. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Saffron Pasta With White Wine & Cream
recipe.description: A luxurious and quick pasta dish featuring saffron-infused sauce with white wine and cream, perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes (optional)

steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt it generously.
Crush saffron threads gently and steep in hot water for 10–15 minutes.
In a sauté pan, simmer white wine over medium heat until reduced by half, about 3–5 minutes.
Lower the heat to medium-low, then whisk in 2 tablespoons of butter one at a time until emulsified.
Stir in the cream, saffron liquid, and a pinch of salt. Simmer for 2 minutes until slightly thickened. Remove from heat.
Cook pasta according to package instructions or until al dente. If using fresh pasta, cook for 2–3 minutes.
Reheat the sauce and transfer pasta to the pan using tongs. Add the remaining butter and toss to coat. Adjust the consistency with pasta cooking water if needed.
Serve immediately, garnished with Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes if desired.

recipe.name: Summery Fresh Tomato & Pistachio Pasta
recipe.description: A refreshing pasta dish featuring fresh tomatoes, toasted pistachios, and a garlic-anchovy paste, served at room temperature for a perfect summer meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: very ripe roma tomatoes, cored and chopped

steps: Toss tomatoes with 2 teaspoons of sea salt in a large bowl and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to macerate.
On a cutting board, smash garlic, anchovies, and a pinch of salt into a smooth paste.
Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside in a large serving bowl.

Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely ground. Add macerated tomatoes with their juices, garlic-anchovy paste, and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano. Pulse until the sauce is smooth but slightly textured.
Mix the tomato mixture with olive oil and toss with the pasta until coated.
Serve pasta at room temperature garnished with basil leaves, cracked black pepper, and extra Parmigiano-Reggiano or olive oil if desired.

recipe.name: Spicy Tomato Beans With ‘Nduja
recipe.description: A quick and hearty dish featuring creamy butter beans in a velvety, spicy tomato sauce flavored with ‘Nduja salami, Parmesan, and heavy cream. Perfect for midweek dinners.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ‘Nduja salami, more or less to taste
cans of butter beans, drained and rinsed

steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté garlic and shallot for about 2 minutes until fragrant and translucent.
Add salt, black pepper, Italian seasoning, and tomato paste. Stir to combine. Add ‘Nduja and mix until melted and evenly incorporated.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan until smooth and creamy.
Add butter beans and mix thoroughly. Sprinkle with lemon juice and simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens and becomes glossy.
Garnish with parsley and serve with freshly grated Parmesan and crusty bread.

recipe.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken Pasta
recipe.description: A comforting dish combining creamy Alfredo sauce, fresh basil pesto, and crispy seared chicken, tossed with pasta for a flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
grated Parmesan, plus extra for serving

steps: Cook pasta in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of cooking water.
To make the pesto, blend basil, pine nuts, Parmesan, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending until combined but slightly textured.
Heat olive oil and half the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, season with salt and pepper, and cook for about 5 minutes until browned. Remove from skillet.

Add remaining butter to the skillet. Sauté garlic for 2 minutes. Pour in cream, bring to a boil, and stir to dissolve browned bits. Add pesto, cooked chicken, and Parmesan. Stir until cheese is melted. Add reserved pasta water if needed to thin the sauce.
Toss in pasta until evenly coated. Serve with grated Parmesan and toasted pine nuts if desired.

recipe.name: Ricotta Polenta with Drunken Meatballs
recipe.description: A rich and satisfying dish with tender meatballs in a savory brown beer gravy served over creamy ricotta-infused polenta.

ingredients.ingredient_name: salt, black pepper, sweet paprika, cayenne, garlic powder, onion powder
dried oregano, dried thyme, black pepper

steps: Mix all meatball ingredients in a bowl and shape into 2-tablespoon-sized balls.
Heat 1 tablespoon butter and 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet. Brown the meatballs on all sides for 10–12 minutes until cooked through. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet, add remaining butter and oil. Cook onions for 5 minutes over low heat. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes.
Stir in oregano, thyme, pepper, and flour. Cook for 1 minute, then pour in brown beer and chicken broth. Add mustard and bring to a boil.
Return meatballs and juices to the skillet. Simmer on low while making the polenta.
Boil chicken stock and milk in a saucepan. Whisk in polenta and cook for 2–3 minutes. Stir in ricotta, Parmesan, butter, salt, and pepper.
Serve polenta topped with meatballs, gravy, and garnished with chives.

recipe.name: Pecorino Romano Cake with Candied Tomatoes
recipe.description: A unique cake combining the savory notes of Pecorino Romano cheese with the sweetness of candied tomatoes, offering a delightful balance of flavors.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the cherry tomatoes with 2 tablespoons of sugar until caramelized. Set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and black pepper.
In another bowl, beat the eggs with the milk and olive oil. Stir in the grated Pecorino Romano cheese.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
Top the batter with the caramelized cherry tomatoes, arranging them evenly.
Bake for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

recipe.name: Roasted Tomato BLT Soup
recipe.description: A unique blend of roasted tomatoes, bacon, and fresh greens, this soup brings together the flavors of a classic BLT sandwich in a bowl. Topped with croutons, arugula, and a garlic mayonnaise drizzle, it’s perfect for any season and can be served hot, warm, or chilled.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Red wine vinegar or lemon juice

steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Halve or quarter the tomatoes and arrange on a baking sheet with the onions, garlic, and oregano. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and roast for 45 minutes, basting occasionally.

Cool the roasted vegetables slightly, peel the tomato skins if desired, and transfer the vegetables and juices to a large pot. Add chicken stock, sugar, red pepper flakes, vinegar, and basil. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Purée the soup using an immersion blender until smooth. Adjust seasoning as needed.
Meanwhile, fry the diced bacon until crispy and set aside. Make the croutons by tossing the bread cubes with olive oil and toasting in the oven until golden.
Prepare the garlic mayonnaise by mashing two of the roasted garlic cloves and mixing with the mayonnaise.
Serve the soup with bacon bits, croutons, arugula, and a drizzle of garlic mayonnaise.

recipe.name: White Bean and Kale Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A hearty soup made with white beans, tender kale, and savory sausage, this comforting dish is perfect for cold days. Flavored with rosemary, garlic, and a splash of white wine, it's a nourishing meal that’s easy to make and packed with flavor.
steps: Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the shallots and sauté until almost translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic, carrots, and mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour in the white wine and let it reduce slightly. Add the vegetable stock, beans, and rosemary. Bring to a boil, then add the chopped kale. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
While the soup cooks, brown the sausage in a separate pan. If using crumbled sausage, add it directly to the soup. For linked sausage, slice and stir into the soup.
Taste the soup and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Serve topped with grated Parmesan and crusty bread.

recipe.name: Vegetarian Mushroom Thyme Gravy
recipe.description: A rich and savory vegetarian gravy made with dried mushrooms, fresh thyme, and a touch of sherry. Perfect for topping mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, or even as a sauce for vegetarian mains.
steps: Bring the vegetable stock to a boil and pour it over the dried mushrooms. Let them soak for 20 minutes, then remove the mushrooms and mince or slice them thinly, reserving the stock.
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter and sauté the shallot for about 5 minutes until softened.
Add the flour to the butter and shallots, stirring constantly for 2 minutes to cook the flour.
Gradually stir in 1 1/2 cups of the reserved mushroom stock. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the minced mushrooms, soy sauce, cream, sherry, and thyme. Cook until heated through and thickened to the desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipe.name: Creamy Tortellini Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A rich and comforting soup with cheese tortellini, Italian sausage, bell pepper, and a creamy tomato broth. Perfect for a cozy meal.
steps: Heat oil and butter in a pot over medium heat. Add bell pepper, sauté for 5 minutes.
Add shallots and garlic, cook for 2 minutes.
Add sausage, oregano, sage, paprika, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Break up the meat and cook until browned, 5 minutes.
Add chicken broth, tomato paste, and puréed tomatoes. Cook for 15 minutes.
Add tortellini, cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cream and Parmesan. Simmer for 1 minute, adjust seasoning, and serve with thyme.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Vegetable Beef Soup
recipe.description: A comforting Instant Pot soup with ground beef, vegetables, and spices, perfect for cozy weeknights.
steps: In the Instant Pot, turn on the Sauté function, add olive oil, and sauté ground beef until browned. Add onion and garlic, cooking another 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, soy sauce, oregano, celery seed, and bay leaves. Cook briefly until fragrant.
Add carrots, beef stock, and diced tomatoes. Lock the lid and pressure cook on high for 20 minutes.
After cooking, stir in peas and green beans, letting them heat through. Add vinegar, adjust salt and pepper, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe.name: Slow Cooker Pasta e Fagioli
recipe.description: A comforting Italian-style soup with beans, pasta, and tomatoes, simmered in a slow cooker for a rich, savory flavor.
steps: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil and sauté onion, carrot, and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add thyme, rosemary, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper, and cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a slow cooker. Add tomatoes (broken into pieces), beans, stock, bay leaf, and Parmesan rind. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours or on low for 5 hours.

If serving immediately, add pasta directly to the slow cooker and cook for 15 minutes. Alternatively, cook pasta separately and add to each bowl before serving to prevent it from absorbing too much broth.
Serve with chopped parsley and grated Parmesan, with crusty bread on the side if desired.

recipe.name: Cheesy Potato Soup with Peppered Scallions
recipe.description: A comforting, creamy potato soup topped with sharp cheese and a peppery, charred scallion garnish for added flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: crème fraîche, sour cream, or Greek yogurt

steps: Melt butter in a stockpot over medium heat. Sauté onions for 5 minutes until translucent, then add garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. Sprinkle in flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 2-3 minutes.
Add cubed potatoes, milk, vegetable stock, salt, rosemary, and thyme. Simmer on medium-low heat for 25-30 minutes until potatoes are fork-tender.

For the peppered scallion topping, coat scallions in olive oil and char them in a hot skillet, about 5 minutes. Remove, cool, and roughly chop. Toast butter in the skillet until browned, then add scallions, lemon zest, juice, and salt. Sizzle for 2 minutes and season with black pepper.
Remove herb stems from the soup, set aside a quarter of the potatoes, and blend the rest until smooth. Add the reserved potatoes for texture.
Stir in cheeses, smoked paprika, cayenne, and adjust salt. Serve with crème fraîche or sour cream and a spoonful of peppered scallions.

recipe.name: Polish Dill Pickle Soup (Zupa Ogórkowa)
recipe.description: A tangy and creamy Polish soup with dill pickles, potatoes, and a touch of horseradish, capturing the flavors of spring and the richness of a hearty soup.

ingredients.ingredient_name: sour cream, plus more for garnish

steps: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add carrots, celery, leek, horseradish, and garlic, seasoning with salt and pepper. Cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring, until vegetables are slightly softened.
Pour in the stock, bring to a boil, then add potatoes and pickles. Reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes until potatoes are tender.
In a bowl, whisk together sour cream, flour, and 1 cup of warm broth from the pot to prevent curdling.
Transfer half of the soup's vegetables and 1 cup of broth to a blender, blend until smooth, and return to the pot. Stir in the sour cream mixture and pickle brine.
Serve warm, garnished with dill and extra sour cream if desired.

recipe.name: Eduardo de San Angel’s Cilantro Soup
recipe.description: A vibrant, creamy cilantro soup inspired by a beloved Mexican restaurant dish, featuring zucchini and spinach for added depth and topped with queso fresco and crema.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small jalapeño pepper, seeded and chopped
cilantro, stems intact, plus more for garnish

steps: In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and onion, cooking until the onion is translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add zucchini, yellow squash, and jalapeño; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add spinach and cilantro, reserving a few sprigs for garnish, and cook until greens have wilted, about 3 minutes.
Pour in broth, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cumin, salt, and pepper, and cook for another 5 minutes. Let soup cool slightly.
In batches, puree the soup in a blender. Strain to remove solids, then rewarm before serving.
Garnish with cilantro sprigs, queso fresco, and crema if desired.

recipe.name: Creamy Green Mung Bean Soup With Warming Spices
recipe.description: A one-pot, velvety green mung bean soup with warming spices, kale, spinach, and coconut milk, inspired by Ayurvedic kitchari.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dried mung beans, soaked 10 to 12 hours in filtered water
leek, quartered and chopped (white and green parts)

steps: Drain and rinse the soaked mung beans and set aside.
Heat ghee or coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and onion, cooking for 6–8 minutes until the onion begins to brown.
Stir in garlic, ginger, leek, and cilantro stems. Cook for another few minutes until softened.
Add ground coriander, cumin, turmeric, mung beans, water, coconut milk, and kombu. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and cover. Simmer for 15–20 minutes until the mung beans are tender.
Add chopped kale and sea salt. Return to a boil, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes until kale stems are tender.
Remove from heat and stir in cilantro and spinach until wilted. Let cool for 10 minutes.
Blend the soup in batches until smooth and velvety. Adjust seasoning with tamari or more salt.
Serve warm with lime wedges and optional garnishes like coconut yogurt, cilantro, or nigella seeds.

recipe.name: Surimi Ochazuke
recipe.description: A comforting Japanese dish featuring rice steeped in a flavorful surimi-infused dashi, topped with crispy pan-fried surimi, fresh vegetables, and garnishes like furikake and scallions.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Wild Alaska Pollock surimi seafood, roughly torn
aji nori furikake, plus more for garnish

steps: Make the dashi: Fill a large pot with 2 quarts of water. Add surimi, garlic, onion, kombu, and 1 teaspoon soy sauce. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Strain the dashi into another pot, reserving surimi, garlic, and onion. Discard kombu. Let the reserved ingredients cool, then slice the onion and garlic, and roughly chop the surimi.

Prepare the topping: Heat 1 teaspoon sesame oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Sauté the sliced onion and garlic until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add remaining sesame oil, neutral oil, ½ teaspoon soy sauce, and half of the chopped surimi. Pan-fry until crispy and golden, about 6 minutes. Repeat with the remaining surimi and soy sauce. Toss with 2 tablespoons furikake.
Bring the strained dashi to a boil. Add carrots and bok choy, cooking for 2–3 minutes until tender-crisp.
Assemble: Fill each bowl with 1 cup of rice. Ladle 1 ½ cups of dashi over the rice, adding carrots and bok choy. Top with crispy surimi, additional furikake, and scallions. Serve with pickled ginger.

recipe.name: Vegetarian French Onion Soup With Asparagus & Cheesy Croutons
recipe.description: A lighter take on French onion soup featuring deeply caramelized onions, tangy vermouth, fresh asparagus, and cheesy croutons for a spring-inspired twist on the classic.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dry vermouth (or white wine vinegar with water)
vegan Worcestershire sauce or soy sauce (optional)
crusty bread, torn into 1- to 2-inch pieces
asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces

steps: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring every 5 minutes, until onions are deeply caramelized, about 40–50 minutes. Scrape the bottom of the pot occasionally and add a splash of water if needed.
Stir in vermouth and cook for 2 minutes. Add Worcestershire sauce and 8 cups water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for 20 minutes. Season with additional salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Toss bread pieces with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 15–20 minutes until crispy. Sprinkle cheese over croutons and bake for an additional 2–3 minutes until melted.
Just before serving, stir asparagus into the soup and cook until bright green, about 2 minutes.
Ladle soup into bowls and top with cheesy croutons. Garnish with black pepper.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Sambhar (Lentils with Tamarind Paste)
recipe.description: A classic South Indian lentil stew made with toor dal, tamarind, aromatic spices, and vegetables, enhanced by a flavorful tadka.
steps: In the Instant Pot, combine toor dal, 2 ½ cups water, tomatoes, onion, sugar, salt, turmeric, cayenne, and sambhar spice mix. Stir to combine.
Secure the lid and cook on Manual High Pressure for 10 minutes. Let naturally release pressure for 10 minutes, then quick-release any remaining pressure.
Puree the cooked mixture directly in the pot with an immersion blender until smooth.
Add remaining water, pearl onions, green beans, and tamarind concentrate to the pot. Secure the lid and cook on Manual High Pressure for 2 minutes. Quick-release pressure.
In a skillet, heat ghee over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds, chiles, and curry leaves. Cook until mustard seeds start to pop, about 30 seconds. Pour the tadka into the sambhar and mix.
Serve the sambhar hot, garnished with cilantro, over rice or with idli.

recipe.name: Boosted Jook
recipe.description: A comforting Chinese rice soup, also known as congee, simmered with fresh ginger and customizable with various toppings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Soy sauce or tamari, for serving

steps: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot, combine the rice, ginger, and water or vegetable stock. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 to 1.5 hours, until the rice breaks down and the jook reaches your desired consistency.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, topped with scallions, sesame oil, soy sauce or tamari, and an optional soft-boiled egg.

recipe.name: Vegetarian Ramen
recipe.description: A flavorful vegetarian ramen with a rich broth made from dried mushrooms, fresh vegetables, and savory seasonings, served with noodles and garnished with tofu and herbs.
steps: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil. Add the dried mushrooms and simmer for 15 minutes to create a rich broth.
Stir in the soy sauce, carrots, celery, and ginger. Cook for an additional 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Meanwhile, cook the ramen noodles according to the package instructions and drain.
Add the cubed tofu to the broth and heat through for 5 minutes.
Divide the cooked ramen noodles among serving bowls and ladle the hot broth and vegetables over the noodles.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Oyster and Spinach Chowder
recipe.description: A comforting and elegant chowder featuring freshly shucked oysters, creamy potatoes, tender spinach, and a touch of cream for a hearty yet refined dish.

ingredients.ingredient_name: freshly shucked oysters and their liquor
diced onion or thinly sliced leek (white and light green parts only)
baby spinach leaves, thick stems discarded

steps: Combine the oyster liquor, clam juice, and water in a bowl. Set aside.
In a medium soup pot, heat butter and olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the onion or leek until softened. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds more.
Add the reserved broth mixture and potatoes to the pot. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the cream and bring back to a simmer. Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Add the oysters and their juices to the pot. Simmer for 3–4 minutes until the oysters are just cooked.
Season the chowder with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Spicy Black Bean & Sweet Potato Soup
recipe.description: A hearty vegetarian soup with roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and a medley of spices, perfect for fall or any chilly day.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
red bell pepper, seeded and diced
jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely diced

steps: Preheat oven to 375°F. Toss cubed sweet potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, ½ teaspoon cumin, ½ teaspoon chili powder, and salt. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes. Let cool to room temperature.
In a large pot, heat the remaining olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onion until translucent, about 3–4 minutes.
Add garlic, red pepper, and jalapeño to the pot. Sauté until softened, about 3 minutes.
Stir in vegetable broth, tomatoes, remaining cumin, chili powder, coriander, oregano, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a gentle boil.
Reduce heat to simmer and add roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and corn. Simmer for 20–30 minutes.
Adjust seasoning as needed. Add cayenne or hot sauce if desired for extra heat. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Rainbow Noodle Bowl With Garlicky-Gingery Broth
recipe.description: A colorful noodle bowl with roasted sweet potatoes, tatsoi, and a flavorful garlicky-ginger broth, garnished with pickled vegetables and a soft egg yolk.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small sweet potato, peeled and sliced into 1/2-inch coins

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss sweet potatoes in olive oil and roast for 15 minutes. Flip the slices and roast for another 5 minutes until tender.
In a medium saucepan, sauté garlic in 1 tablespoon olive oil for 2–3 minutes until fragrant. Add ginger and cook for another 5 minutes.
Deglaze the pan with 1 cup of stock, then add remaining stock and fish sauce. Simmer and adjust seasoning.
Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Add tatsoi to the broth and simmer for 2–3 minutes until wilted.
Separate the egg yolks from the whites. Place each yolk in a small bowl.
Divide broth and tatsoi between two bowls. Add noodles in the center, creating a well for the yolk. Arrange sweet potato and radish slices along the edges.
Top with pickles, chili sauce, and crispy seasoning. Carefully add the yolk to the well and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Vegetable Soup With Roasted Tomato Pistou
recipe.description: A hearty vegetable soup enhanced with a rich, roasted tomato pistou, customizable with your favorite vegetables and perfect for meal prepping.
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss cherry tomatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, pepper, thyme, and red pepper flakes. Roast alongside foil-wrapped garlic cloves for 25–30 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté potatoes, carrots, fennel, and leeks with salt until softened and slightly caramelized.
Add rosemary or thyme, then pour in the stock. Stir in white beans and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Add green beans and greens, cooking until tender and vibrant.
For the pistou, pulse roasted tomatoes, garlic (skins removed), fennel fronds, and basil in a food processor. Stream in olive oil until smooth but chunky.
Serve the soup topped with a generous spoonful of pistou. Optionally garnish with cheese or toasted bread.

recipe.name: Sazón Ramen
recipe.description: A fusion of Latin American and Asian flavors featuring instant ramen with sazón spice blend, shrimp, spinach, and a garlicky sofrito base, topped with soft-boiled eggs and lime.

ingredients.ingredient_name: diced yellow onion (about ¼ small onion)
diced green bell pepper (about ¼ bell pepper)
instant ramen (any variety), seasoning packets reserved

steps: In a medium pot over high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil until shimmering. Pat shrimp dry and season with ¼ teaspoon salt. Sear in batches until lightly browned and pink, about 30 seconds per side. Remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium and add the remaining olive oil, onion, bell pepper, and garlic. Sauté until softened and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add 4 cups of water, sazón, dashi, remaining salt, and half a ramen seasoning packet. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Add ramen noodles and cook per package instructions. Remove from heat and stir in spinach until wilted.
Divide soup into bowls and top with shrimp, cilantro, eggs, and sesame seeds if using. Serve immediately with lime wedges.

recipe.name: Nana's New-Style Albondigas Soup
recipe.description: A comforting albondigas soup made with tender meatballs, vibrant vegetables, and a flavorful broth, inspired by a family recipe with a modern twist.

ingredients.ingredient_name: celery heart, stalks cut into bite-sized pieces
carrots, peeled and cut into bite-sized pieces
zucchini squash, cut into bite-sized pieces
long grain white rice, soaked overnight
ground beef (or ground turkey or chicken)

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion, tomato, celery leaves, garlic, salt, cumin, and 1 ½ teaspoons oregano until onions are translucent and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add broth and bring to a boil. Add carrots, zucchini, chayote, potato, and celery stalks. Cover and simmer over medium heat for 15–20 minutes until vegetables are fork-tender.
Strain soaked rice and mix with ground beef, remaining oregano, mint, flour, garlic salt, pepper, and egg. Form into golf ball-sized meatballs (about 20).
Add meatballs to the simmering soup. Return to a boil, add mint sprigs, and simmer for 8–10 minutes until meatballs float.
Reduce to a low simmer for another 20 minutes until meatballs and rice are fully cooked. Remove mint sprigs, adjust seasoning, and stir in lime juice.
Serve hot and garnish with fresh oregano and additional mint.

recipe.name: White Borscht
recipe.description: A creamy Polish soup made with smoked kielbasa, potatoes, vegetables, and a tangy rye and sour cream base, perfect for Easter or any comforting meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: smoked kielbasa, cut into 3 or 4 pieces
Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and quartered

steps: In a large saucepan, bring kielbasa, potatoes, broth, peppercorns, bay leaves, 1 teaspoon salt, and 4 cups of water to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 minutes.

In a heavy stockpot, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onions, stirring occasionally, until softened. Add celery, parsnip, carrots, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add 1 cup of broth from the saucepan to the vegetables. Scrape the pot's bottom to release browned bits. Cover and cook on low heat for 15 minutes.

Remove kielbasa from the broth and set aside. Check potatoes for doneness. Transfer broth and potatoes to the vegetable pot. Add rye bread, vinegar, black pepper, and 1 teaspoon salt. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. Stir in sour cream and parsley until combined.
Slice kielbasa and arrange in bowls with hard-boiled eggs. Ladle soup over and garnish with more parsley. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Turkey Avgolemono
recipe.description: A hearty and tangy Greek-inspired soup made with turkey or chicken stock, eggs, lemon juice, and rice, perfect for Thanksgiving leftovers.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cooked chicken or turkey, pulled into pieces

steps: Heat the stock in a large pot over medium heat.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs vigorously until frothy. Gradually add the lemon juice while continuing to whisk.
Slowly drizzle 1 to 2 quarts of hot stock into the egg-lemon mixture, whisking constantly to temper the eggs.
Pour the tempered egg mixture back into the pot with the remaining stock. Add the rice and turkey or chicken.
Bring the soup to a brief boil, then reduce heat and simmer until slightly thickened.
Season with salt and white pepper to taste. Garnish with a drizzle of olive oil and chopped parsley before serving.

recipe.name: Chinese Tomato & Egg Dough Drop Soup (Geda Tang)
recipe.description: A simple yet comforting Northern Chinese soup featuring velvety broth, dough drops, tomatoes, eggs, and garnished with cilantro and chili oil.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cilantro leaves (or extra scallions), loosely packed

steps: In a small bowl, mix the flour and warm water with chopsticks until smooth and slightly runny. Set aside.
Whisk eggs in a separate bowl until yolks and whites are fully incorporated.
Bring chicken stock to a rolling boil in a small pot.

Heat oil in another medium pot until smoking. Add scrambled eggs, stir quickly, and let them bubble for about 20 seconds. Before the eggs fully set, pour the boiling stock into the pot to create a bubbling, emulsified soup base.
Add tomatoes and scallions to the soup. Season with salt, sugar, MSG, and white pepper. Simmer for 2 minutes.
With the soup simmering, use a ladle and slotted spoon to drop the wet dough through a colander or spoon into the soup to form small dumplings. Bring to a boil and cook until dough is fully cooked.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro leaves and a drizzle of chili oil.
